Aisha lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of two additional family members. She lives in her own house; the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

Aisha sells secondhand clothes at the market. She works six days a week and has been in this business for the last three years. She has requested a loan of 1,200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of secondhand clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation, increasing prices of secondhand clothes, and seasonality. Her goal is to expand her business into a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all her children go to school .She also takes care of additional family members. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

Eva sells new clothes in a retail shop. She works seven days a week and has been in business for the last ten years. She also has rental houses from which she gets additional income. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy new dresses, skirs, shirts, and blouses to sell.

loans.use: to buy more dresses, skirts, shirts, and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Bena

texts.en:
Bena lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with four children and none of  her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She sells baby clothes door-to-door on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last five years. She also has rental houses where she gets additional income. 

She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used baby clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a plot of land and build more rental houses and also to get a permanent business premise. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is sixty-nine years old. Erlinda is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Erlinda runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products to the local community. Erlinda has been in her business for five years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Erlinda is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2008, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita, sixty-seven, is a widow with four children. She is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She used her last loan to purchase daily-use commodities to sell. Her business is successful, and she's taking a new loan to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Sapia

texts.en:
Sapia is married. She is twenty-nine years old, and resides in Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Sapia operates a fishing business, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. She's been in this business for ten years and earns PHP 2,000 a month from it. She requested a loan of PHP 4,500 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. 

In 2008, Sapia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Sapia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar, de 41 años, un señor responsable, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Lucia de 41 años y sus 05 estimados hijos a quienes desea brindar un buen bienestar. Cesar, es un hombre de lucro se dedica con mucho cuidado a sembrar  plantaciones de café, actividad que realiza hace mas de 31 años. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de jornaleros, de esa manera extrae rápido los frutos para luego venderlas en los centros de acopio, quienes le gratifican buena ganancia por cada kilogramo de café. A pesar de todo le resulta difícil el transportar su sacos de cosecha hasta la localidad de Palpamapampa lugar donde se encuentran las empresas acopiadoras. Ahora lo que prioriza es poder realizar el mantenimiento de sus plantas es decir fertilizando sus plantas ya que de la misma manera pueda tener buenos resultado en sus próximas cosechas. Este será su crédito numero 01 con MFP,  se siente muy contento por la confianza que le dan y esta dispuesto a pagar sus cuotas mensuales ya que de esa manera podrá acceder a otro préstamo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar abono para realizar el mantenimiento de sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Cesar, age 41, is a responsable man.  He lives in his own house with his 41 year old wife, Lucia, and their five cherished children.  He wants to provide them with a good state of well-being.

Cesar is a productive man.  He devotes himself to growing coffee with great care.  He has been doing this for over 31 years.  During harvest time he has help from his children and day workers.  This way they can extract the fruit quickly and later sell it at the collection centers.  At the collection center they reward him with good earnings for each kilogram of coffee.

In spite of everything, it is difficult for him to transport the sacks of his harvest to Palpamapampa.  This is where the companies that act as middle men are located.  

His priority now is for maintenance of his plants, which means to say fertilizing the plants to be able to have good results in the coming harvests.

This will be his first loan with MFP.  He is very happy for the trust shown in him.  He is prepared to make his monthly payments because this is the way to be able to access another loan.  He will use the 1,000 soles to buy fertilizer for the maintenance of his crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores, de 38 años, una mujer alegre y luchadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja David de 41 años, quienes esperan un buen bienestar en lapso de tiempo. Dolores, es una mujer sencilla pero con el entusiasmo de sobresalir en la vida; se dedica a remover la tierra para luego cultivar café. A través de 20 años lleva trabajando en su propio terreno con la finalidad de hacer crecer sus plantaciones y poder obtener buena ganancia de las cosechas.  Considera que lo más fácil es tener el apoyo de su pareja ya que de esa manera ambos se esfuerzan por tener los mejores resultados de sus plantaciones. Ahora prioriza en sembrar nuevas  plantas de café par incrementarlos en sus hectáreas de terreno. Este será su crédito numero 12 con MFP, se siente agradecida por la confianza que obtiene por parte de los financistas y asegura que seguirá siendo puntual en sus cuotas de pago. En su banco comunal es muy querida por ser responsable. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, comprará plantas de café para sembrar en su campo de cultivo.
texts.en:
38-year-old Dolores is a very cheerful and tenacious woman.  She lives in her own home together with her partner, 41-year-old David.  The couple hope to do well in the future.  Dolores is a modest woman but she is keen to do well in life.  Her business is working her land so that she can grow coffee.  She has been working on her own plot of land for 20 years with the aim of growing her plantings and making a good profit on her harvests.  She has the support of her partner which makes her life easier.  Both of them work hard so that they have good results from their plantings.  Right now, Dolores' priority is sowing new coffee plants so that she can increase the number she has on her hectares of land.

This will be Dolores' twelfth loan from MFP and she feels grateful for the trust that is placed in her.  She assures us that she will continue being punctual in making her repayments.  She is a very well liked member of her community bank because she is responsible.  Dolores will use her 2,000 soles to buy coffee plants to grow on her farmland.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants

loans.name: Sakiatou

texts.fr: Sakiatou est une femme  âgée de 26 ans. Elle est mariée å un  couturier-brodeur. Elle a 03 enfants. Sakiatou travaille comme revendeuse de sacs de charbons de bois  depuis 2001. Elle vend à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Blitta (une localité située à quelques kilomètres de la ville de Lomé. Sakiatou a requis son troisième cycle de crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
Sakiatou is a 26-year old woman who is married to a tailor/embroiderer and has three children. She has worked as a retailer of sacks of charcoal since 2001 and sells from home. She buys her products in Blitta (a town which lies several kilometers from Lomé).

Sakiatou has requested her third loan from WAGES so that she can buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Abossedé Marie-Rose

texts.fr: Marie-Rose est mariée,agée de 51 ans et mère de quatre enfants. Elle commercialise des tissus pagnes.En vue d'achalander son stock et d'avoir un grand nombre de profit elle a sollicité un financement auprès de Finadev pour son bien-etre familiale.
texts.en: Marie-Rose is married, 51 years old and mother to four children. She trades in "pagne" (brightly coloured West African) fabrics. She has requested a loan from Finadev, with a view to building up her stock and making a large profit, so that she can take care of her family.

loans.use: 30 pieces of fabric

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a married woman with two children. Esterlita is forty-five years old, and resides in Panduma, Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Esterlita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for eleven years and earns PHP 3,000 a month from it. 

Esterlita requested a loan of PHP 5,300 to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2010, Esterlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Esterlita wants to build a house and to support her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Toem

texts.en:
Mrs. Toem, forty-two, is a humble villager who lives in Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province. She has a common law relationship with her husband who sells groceries from their home, and she has been blessed with two children; one is married and one is single. She generates her income by making a kind of cake which she sells to people in her neighborhood. This cake can be eaten with tea or coffee and sometimes we can eat it with porridge as well. She typically earns around $3.00 per day.

Toem will use the amount she is requesting from HKL and Kiva to pay for the work that is being done on her house, which is currently under repair. And with the remaining funds, she’ll buy a stock of merchandise to support her husband’s business. In the future, Toem hopes to expand her store and sell many products to satisfy her customers and thereby increase her household income.

loans.use: to pay for the work that is being done on her house which is currently under repair.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 38 años de edad es madre soltera y cuenta con 2 hijos. Viven en casa propia la cual está ubicada en  Av. Cevallos Gómez lote 01, en la una zona rural a unos30 minutos del Dist. Tambogrande de la Provincia de Piura, aproximadamente a unas 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Mercedes se dedica a la venta de frutas y jugos  de lunes a viernes en su propio domicilio, a mencionada actividad se dedica ya un aproximado de 3 años. Su negocio es muy conocido por los moradores de la zona y según nos comenta Susana cuenta con buena concurrencia de clientes.
Sus ventas diarias son muy buenas, pues su negocio está ubicado en una zona muy estratégica, específicamente frente al paradero de combis y motos del caserío.

Mercedes desea utilizar el crédito solicitado para la compra de frutas que le permita tener en stock debido a que hay demanda suficiente a la que desea satisfacer y adicionalmente para la compra de sillas y mesas, lo que permitirá brindar una mejor atención a su publico, por lo que solicita un crédito de 1500 Nuevos Soles.

Mercedes es una persona muy considerada y admirada por los moradores de la zona en donde vive.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 38, is a single mother with 2 children.  They live in a house she owns in a rural part of Piura province, about 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Mercedes operates a business selling fruits and juices from her house.  She has operated the business for 3 years, working Mondays to Fridays.  She tell us that the business is well known in the neighborhood and that she has a steady stream of customers because it's just across from the area's bus stop and convenient to anyone waiting there.

Mercedes plans to use this loan to stock her business with the fruits and juices that she sells.  She also wants to buy tables and chairs so that she can attract more customers.  She estimates the investment will cost 1500 new soles, so she is applying for a loan for that amounts.

Mercedes is well liked and admired by the people of her community.

loans.use: To purchase fruit, tables, and chairs.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José tiene 23 años de edad, es hijo único, soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres, la cual aun no cuenta con  servicio básico de energía eléctrica y agua potable, la casa está ubicada en  el Caserío de Santa Elena del Distrito de Las Lomas, perteneciente a la Provincia de Piura la cual esta ubicada a unas 3 horas de la Ciudad de Chiclayo.

José con su esfuerzo y dedicación al trabajo ha logrado un comprar una mototaxy, la cual actualmente le sirve para realizar el servicio de transporte en la misma zona donde vive generándose ingresos diarios para el sustento de su familia. Adicionalmente brinda servicios de peón en parcelas agrícolas. La relación con sus padres es muy buena, pues todos están comprometidos con los deseos de salir adelante económicamente.

José en su deseo de implementar y mejorar el funcionamiento de su Vehiculo desea reparar y comprar un toldo, por que solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 Nuevos Soles. Esta inversión le permitirá dar una mejor imagen y brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes.

José y su familia son muy respetados y considerados por los moradores de la zona en la que viven, su arduo trabajo y su buen comportamiento ha generado el respeto que se merecen por todos sus vecinos.
texts.en:
José is 23 years old.  He is an only child, single, and doesn't have any children.  He lives in his parents' home which does not yet receive basic services of electricity and drinking water.   The house is located in the small village of Santa Elena, in Las Lomas district, in Piura province, three hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Through his hard work and commitment to his work, José has managed to buy a motorcycle taxi which he uses to provide a transport service in his area.  This makes him daily income with which to support his family.  He also works as an agricultural laborer.  His relationship with his parents is very good as they are all committed to their desire to make progress financially.

José would like to improve his vehicle.  He would like to repair it and buy a canopy.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  This investment will enable him to present a better image of his business and provide a better service to his customers.

José and his family are very well respected and thought of by the people who live in their area.  Their hard work and good behavior have gained the respect they deserve from all their neighbors.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle and buy a canopy for it so that he can provide a better service

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is widow who has one child. Erlinda is sixty-five years old, and resides at Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Philippines. 

Erlinda owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for four years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,000 from this business. She requested a loan of PHP 2,500 to purchase additional products to sell. 

In 2010, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Erlinda wants to build a house and to help her child finish studying.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 40 years old and married, with two children aged 19 and 15 years respectively. She sells clothes, a business she has been in for the past 20 years.  She earns a monthly income of KES 80,000. 

She has applied for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy more shirts, trousers, dresses and shorts for sale. The anticipated profit will aid her in paying college and secondary fees for her children as well as paying for rent and food. Her dream is that one day she will become an employer.

loans.use: To purchase shirts, trousers, dresses and shorts for sale.

loans.name: Sop Naby Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité  Sop Naby est créé depuis le 27 décembre 2010 ; il est constitué de douze femmes qui ont des liens de parenté. Le commerce est leur principale activité.

Madame Diéwo la responsable est âgée de 54 ans, mariée elle est mère de six enfants; elle est couturière et mène une activité de confection et vente de draps. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en tunique blanche-bleue couverte d'un châle blanc et portant des lunettes. Elle est expérimentée en couture mais mène l'activité de commercialisation depuis plus d'un an.

Elle achète les tissus dans une grande ville, confectionne et vend dans sa localité.


Elle compte avec son prêt acheter une bonne quantité de tissus pour satisfaire sa clientèle mais aussi pour espérer gagner plus de revenus.


Ses bénéfices obtenus lui permettent de subvenir aux divers besoins de ses enfants et elle souhaite élargir son activité.
texts.en:
The Sop Naby solidarity group was set up on 27th December 2010 and is made up of twelve women who are relatives. Their main activity is trading.

Diewo, who is in charge of the group, is 54 years old, married and mother to six children. She is a dressmaker and has a sewing business as well as selling sheets. She is standing on the right of the photo wearing a white and blue tunic covered in a white shawl; she also wears glasses. She is an experienced dressmaker but has been trading for only just over a year.

She buys her fabrics in a large town, then makes them up and sells them in her town.

She is planning to buy a large quantity of fabric with her loan so that she can satisfy customer demand. She is also hoping to increase her income. The profits she makes allow her to provide for her children's various needs and she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make up and sell

loans.name: Celedonio

texts.en:
Celedonio is married with 3 children.  Celedonio is 53 years old and lives in Osukan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Celedonio ownes a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years.  Each month, he earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work.  He has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase more stocks for his general store.  Celedonio is a new member of PMPC.  In the future, Celedonio hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks for his general store.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is from Pantaon Ozamiz City.  She is 25 years old.  Mary Ann is married and has 2 children.  To make a living, Mary Ann owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops, planting and harvesting bananas for sale.  

Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.  In 2011, Mary Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is from Panta-on, Ozamiz City.  She is 45 years old.  Josephine is married and has six children.  To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a business planting and harvesting corn and bananas for sale. 

Josephine has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.  In 2008, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Josephine is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoeun, who is from Pouk district, has spent most her life dedicated to rice husbandry. Outside the rainy season, Hoeun also uses her time to make baskets at home to improve her living conditions. She is married and her husband works as construction worker around Siem Reap province. Presently Hoeun is thirty-seven and has only one child who is attending school.

Hoeun is taking her first loan from HKL to buy construction supplies to support in her husband’s business. This loan will sustain his business and save her family from difficulties. For her future prospects, she hopes to expand her basket-making business and wants to own a store in a busy market of the province so she can trade in her products.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to support her husband’s business.

loans.name: Lillian Maria

texts.es: Lillian Maria es una emprendedora que inicio su negocio con muchos esfuerzos, sus  objetivos de Lillian era de tener un medio donde podría generar ingresos  y poder salir adelante cada día. Lillian ya es cliente de Fundación León 2000, durante el crédito que se le otorgo ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con ganas de seguir adelante de crecer y cumplir su sueño de tener una distribuidora en el futuro. Ella actualmente esta financiamiento para comprar mercadería para la pulpería lo cual comprar golosinas, granos básicos, aceite, jabón, detergente, cloro, entre otros productos.
texts.en: Lillian Maria is an enterprising woman who had to work especially hard to start her own business.  Her goal was to find a way to support herself and improve her quality of life.  Lillian is a long-standing customer of Fundacion Leon 2000 and she has proved herself to be a responsible borrower.  She wants to continue growing and working toward her goal of building a wholesale business.  For now, she wants to borrow money to invest in stocking her corner shop with the products she sells: snacks, grains, cooking oil, soap, detergent, cleaner, etc.

loans.use: to buy snacks, grains, cooking oil, soap, detergent, cleaner, etc.

loans.name: Cristina Gabriela

texts.es:
La señora Gabriela es de la ciudad Pisco, ella tiene 32 años y trabaja como agricultora desde hace más de 3 años, ella aprendió de esta actividad gracias a sus padres, los mismos que se dedicaron mucho a incentivarle el cuidado de la naturaleza.

Actualmente ella se encuentra en etapa de independizarse, para ello quiere hacer una cosecha considerable, ella ya ha solicitado créditos anteriormente y los ha demostrado ser una muy buena cliente. Es por ello que en esta oportunidad  desea que los prestatarios Kiva puedan ayudarla y así ella podrá comprar algunos remedios curativos para sus plantan, tales como abonos, pesticidas y otros plaguicidas necesarios para su nuevo cultivo.

Su sueño es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus 2 menores hijos, desea también poder tener su propio terreno y consolidarse como una persona independiente. También nos comentó que desea mucho poder exportar al extranjero productos como Maíz Amarillo, Maíz Blanco y Algodón.
texts.en:
Gabriela is from the city of Pisco.  She is 32 years old and has been working as a farmer for more than three years.  She learned this business from her parents who spent a lot of effort motivating her to care for nature.

Gabriela is currently in the process of becoming independent.  For this reason, she would like to have a good harvest.  She has requested loans in the past and has shown herself to be a very good client.  On this occasion, she would like Kiva lenders to help her so that she can buy some products for taking care of her plants such as fertilizers and pesticides that she needs for her new crops.

Gabriela's dream is to improve the quality of life of her two dependent children.  She would also like to own her own plot of land and strengthen her position as an independent person.  She tells us that she would very much like to be able to export products abroad such as yellow corn, white corn and cotton.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Tsitsino

texts.en:
Tsitsino lives in a small village in Khelvachauri District, West Georgia. She is married and lives with her husband, Nugzar, four children (13, 9, 8 and 2 years old) and parents-in-law (retired). The elder children go to school. The only source of the income for the family is agriculture. Tsitsino and Nugzar  lead the family agricultural business. They have 0.4 hectare of land, where fruits and vegetables are grown. Harvested products are sold to local greengrocery retailers. The family also owns a milk cow. Tsitsino produces cheese and sells on average 10 kg of this product in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris, including the pensions of Tsitsino’s parents-in-law. 

Tsitsino requested credit to purchase an additional milk cow. With two cows, Tsitsino will increase the production and sales of cheese by 150%. The income of the family will increase and the family will be able to spend more on satisfying the children's needs and financing their education.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow to expand the dairy farm

loans.name: Verna

texts.en:
Verna is a married woman with 2 children.  Verna is 38 years old, residing at Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  Verna owns and operates a retail business, selling gasoline to motorists to earn a living and she's been in this business for 2 years. 

Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business.  She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional gasoline to sell.  This year, Verna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  Verna hopes to be able to build a house and to have her children finish their schooling.

loans.use: To purchase additional gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa, is married.  She is 46 years old and lives in Calabayan Ozamis City: Philippines.  Felisa plants, harvests and sells bananas and corn as a source of income and she's been in this business for 5 years. 

Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP doing this type of business.  She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  Recently this year, Felisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  In the future, Felisa wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Lennie

texts.en: This time Lennie is borrowing PHP 17,000 to fund her general store business. The ready-to-wear clothing business that she previously funded through NWTF and Kiva continues to provide for Lennie and her family and helps with increasing and expanding her business operations.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 60 years old, married and has 5 children.

Leonila works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, noodles and other miscellaneous items.

Leonila has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the variety store for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending.  Leonila aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items like canned goods, noodles and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Jaquiline

texts.en:
Jaquiline is 22 years old, single, residing at Clarin, Misamis Occidental: Philippines.  Jaquiline owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been 2 years in this business.  

Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business.  She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering.  This year, Jaquiline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  Jaquiline wants to save money as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 37 years old and lives in Taboc Sur, Oroquieta City.  She is married with three children. 
Gina has a fish vending business and owns a fishing boat business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase a fishing boat for her fish selling business.  Gina has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat for her fish selling business.

loans.name: Ma. Elma

texts.en: Now, Ma. Elma is applying for a loan of PHP 29,500 to fund her general store business.  The General Store and food vending that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide income for Ma. Elma and her family.  Ma. Elma also engages in another business to earn additional income.

loans.use: To buy items like biscuits and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie is twenty-eight years old and married. She's from Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Rosalie used her last loan to buy food supplies for a vending job. Her business grew and become successful. Now she's taking a new loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
This time Stella is borrowing PHP 12,000 to fund and continue her fish vending business. The fish vending business that she previously funded through NWTF and Kiva continues to provide Stella and her family with income that allows her to improve her business and send her children to school. 


*This picture was taken during tabu or market day.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is sixty-two years old, married, and has seven children. With one child in school, Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Gloria has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

Gloria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Mohamed S.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is a group of primary school teachers from Madina village, near Kabala town in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 5,200,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to solve their immediate financial challenges.  At the end of each month they repay the loan, using their monthly salaries.

Mohamed is the leader of this group of teachers. The 51 year old is married to a small-businesswoman. A native of Madina village, Mohamed has been a teacher for 30 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy building materials – iron corrugated zincs, etc,. for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to buy building materials – iron corrugated zincs, etc., for the construction of a house

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina, de 61 años, una mujer sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su amado esposo Benjamín de 64 años y junto a ellos su querida hija Yovana de 22 años a quien estiman y dan un buen bienestar. Cristina, es una mujer muy bondadosa y con ganas de seguir trabajando sin importar su edad. A lado de su esposo Benjamín que apoya en los momentos más difíciles; ambos nos comentan que desde muy jóvenes llegaron a casarse y hasta hoy viven felices. Benjamín, se dedica a labrar la tierra para cultivar plantas de cacao, plátano, mango y entre otras frutas, mientras que Cristina los lleva a vender sus frutas en el paradero de San Francisco con salida para la ciudad de Ayacucho. A pesar de la competencia que hay,  siempre logra vender más frutas. Desde que empezó a solicitar su préstamo en MFP, le va muy bien ya que en tiempos de producción de frutas, Cristina los llega a vender todas sus frutas. Al igual que también encuentra dificultades cuando no hay mucha venta.  Este será su crédito número 15 con MFP, se siente agradecida por la confianza de los financistas. En su Banco comunal es una socia solidaria y responsable. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará cajones para que pueda poner sus frutas y los lleve a vender.
texts.en:
Cristina, 61, and her husband, Benjamin, 64, live in a house they own with their daughter, Yovana, 22.  Yovana is very dear to them both and they work hard to provide for her.  Cristina is a kind, generous woman and she wants to continue working, no matter her age.  She was lucky, she says, to have married Benjamin because he has supported her through thick and thin.  They married young and both say that it's been a happy and successful marriage.  Benjamin is a farmer.  He grows cacao, platanos, mangoes and other fruit.  Cristina hauls her fruit to a well-trafficked spot in San Francisco where bus passengers wait for the bus to Ayacucho.  Despite the competition there, she always sells everything she brings.  She says that she is happy with the progress of the business in the time that she's worked with MFP and that this will be her 15th MFP loan.  She adds that she is grateful for your confidence in her.  The members of her community bank consider her to be a supportive and responsible member.  
Cristina will use this 1,000 new soles loan to stock her fruit sales business.

loans.use: to stock her fruit sales business.

loans.name: Margerita

texts.en:
Margerita, is a 29-year-old lady and is married to Laazar, a 40-year-old man. They are blessed with three children, namely: Willy, 11, Feren, 10 and Indra, 6, who are attending Elementary School.  

Margerita owns a business selling fried bananas, donuts, various candies, fried corn, soft drinks, other snacks, etc. She displays all products on the table as she does not have stall for them. She initiated the business in 2004 by using capital provided by her husband. 

To generate more income, Margerita intends to add more stock in her business. She hopes the income from this business can help her in covering her children's school fees and their living expenses as well. Therefore she is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 3,000,000.  She plans to spend the loan on snacks, candies, fruit, and cakes. She is expecting that TLM will provide a loan for her shortly.

loans.use: To purchase snacks, candies, fruits, and cakes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new spare parts.

loans.name: Imron

texts.en:
Imron, 43, is a father of four children: Prisilia, 20, is studying at University; Cilia, 12, is studying at Junior High School; Septhia, 10 and Aldo, 8, are both Elementary School students.

Imron owns a business offering photocopying, book and thesis bindery, and laminating. He has been engaged in the business for 10 years. He rented a small building which is located nearby the main road. He usually opens the business at 8am and works until 8pm. In order to serve the customers quickly, Imron employs four people to help him run the business.   

At the moment, Imron is receiving many orders from the customers but he is worrying about the paper supply. He has saved part of his income but he would like to use that money for his daughter’s tuition fees. 

Imron knows that TLM provides an Individual Lending Program that can assist him in meeting all orders. He submitted a loan application and requested a loan of IDR 10,000,000. This loan will be spending on paper. Imron really hopes that TLM will provide him with the loan for his business improvement.

loans.use: To purchase paper.

loans.name: Ananias

texts.en:
Ananias is a 59-year-old father of three children. He is living in Mantic Tangub City, Philippines. He has been sewing for 10 years and continues to do so today. Dresses are designed according to the customer's desired style, or sometimes he creates out of his own imagination. Every month, he receives 1,500 PHP which is fair enough to cover day-to-day expenses. 

Ananias joined Gata Daku MPC in 2010. He applied for a loan of PHP 3,750 from the cooperative to buy sewing materials such as textiles, thread, etc. By having all necessary materials, Ananias hopes to create as much output as he can to have more income. He is planning also to expand in his business area and/or buy another set of sewing machines.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as textiles, thread, etc.

loans.name: Kat

texts.en:
Mrs. Kat is a 45-year-old married woman, living in Ornlong Veng district with her husband and three single children. Her oldest child has already started a new family. Kat is engaged in a farming business to generate her income. She grows her crops based on the season: rice in the rainy season and vegetables and potatoes in the dry season.
 
Now she would like to ask for a loan from HKL, a partner of Kiva, to purchase farming materials such as seeds, fertilizers and some necessary tools. She is very appreciative for the support of her business. Her living conditions will improve through this loan.

loans.use: to purchase farming materials such as seeds, fertilizers, and tools

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a twenty-two-year-old, mother of two children. She lives in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where her wide array of corn production is located. She has been cultivating this land since she was nineteen. She doesn't mind the scratches and itches brought on by this kind of plant, for as long as she can earn income, Marites goes for it. She normally receives PHP 2,000 a month. 

In 2011, Marites  joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 4,220 to purchase fertilizers such as manure to increase production. When the crop gets sold, the revenue will be allotted to expanding the business to earn more income and to sustain her daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure to increase production.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 41 years old and married with eight children.

Nilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Nilda has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal retail business for 12 years and also earns an income from buying and selling coconuts.

Nilda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines.

Gemma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more ready-to-wear clothing to sell to customers. She has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Samuela

texts.en:
Samuela is 53 years old and lives in Culpan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Samuela has a fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. 

Samuela has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Samuela hopes to have a fishing boat.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen works hard to support her family. Aileen is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Aileen requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and repair fishing boat. Aileen has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Aileen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing net and repair fishing boat.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 59 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Nelly is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nelly has been farming sugarcane for 15 years and also earns additional income from food vending and raising livestock. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, 49, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Rodolfo, a driver, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
 
Susan operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 17,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Susan dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is married with three children. Isabel is 62 years old and lives in ZNAC, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Isabel has a piggery as her business. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested 50,000 PHP to purchase more pigs, feed and vitamins for her pig business.

Isabel is a new member of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs,  feed, and vitamins for her pig-raising business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is married with twelve children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Angelina is 59 years old and has two children who are in school.

Angelina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Angelina requested a PHP 12,500 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Angelina has been in this business for 39 years. In the future, Angelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene works hard to support her family. She is single and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Mylene requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Mylene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Edelina

texts.en: This time Edelina is borrowing Php 10,000 to fund her general store retail business. The general store business that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide her additional capital to build and expand her business operations.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for fertilizers for his farming business and supplies for his family custard sales business.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL PROGRESO - UMUTO”; este banco se encuentra situado a tres horas de la misma ciudad del Cusco, en el Distrito de Quispicanchis de la Provincia de Ocongate Departamento de Cusco.
La socia Susana; la socia tiene 65 años de edad; ella es casada, la socia se dedica a la venta de tejidos artesanales, la socia trasquila a las ovejas la lana y las tiñe con óxidos naturales y luego de esto ella hila la lana hasta dejarla con una sola hebra, la socia teje mantas, frazadas, ponchos, y muchos trabajos más para la venta. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de lanas de ovejas y de ovejas para la fabricación de sus trabajos artesanales como tejidos.
La socia agradece la oportunidad del préstamo que le permitirá invertir en el negocio y crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “EL PROGRESO - UMUTO” communal bank. This bank is located three hours from the city of Cuzco, in the district of Quispicanchis, province of Ocongate, department of Cuzco.

Her name is Susana. She is 65 years old and is married. She sells artisanal weaving. She shears the sheep wool and dyes it with natural oxides. Later she spins the wool until it is a singe thread. She weaves tablecloths, blankets, ponchos and much more to sell. She is asking for the loan to invest in buying sheep's wool and sheep for making her artisanal work, such as kniting. 

She is thankful for the opportunity of the loan which will allow her to invest in her business and grow financially.

loans.use: to invest in buying sheep's wool and sheep for making her artisanal knitting.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
This is Angela, 59, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Angela operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Angela earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Angela dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is married with 4 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cristina is 43 years old and 3 of her children are in school.

Cristina has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall. Cristina has been in this business for 9 years. 

In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en: This time, Geronima is borrowing 12,000 PHP to fund her sari-sari store business. The hog-raising business that she previously funded through NWTF and Kiva continues to provide her and her family with increasing income and improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Revaz

texts.en:
Revaz is from the village of Charnali in West Georgia. He is 57 years old, married and lives with his family; his wife Zera and two adult sons (28 and 25 years old). All family members are involved in family agricultural activities. They own 0.5 hectare of land, where citrus, fruits and vegetables are grown. Harvested products are sold to local greengrocery products retailers.  The family also owns 2 milk cows. Zera produces cheese and sells on average 40 kg of this product to local stores. Along with the agricultural farm the family owns a saw-mill. They process orders and get service fees. Total average monthly income of the family is 640 Laris. 

Revaz requested credit for purchasing materials for greenhouse construction. He will grow greens. Harvested products will be sold to partner retailers. It will increase the income of the family. They will be able to purchase additional household goods and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse construction

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en: Felicidad is from Malibangcao, Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 65 years old. Felicidad is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Felicidad owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting bananas for sale in the local community. Felicidad has been engaged in her business for 7 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2005, Felicidad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felicidad is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Nan

texts.en: Mrs. Nan, age 39, is a local rice cultivator from Kompong Cham province. She lives there with her husband and 4 single children. They are still students and depend on her income. Nan is able to earn a low income from her business because she owns a few pieces of farmland, which only provide her family's daily food. However, the main income is generated by her husband who has skill in producing Khmer noodle, which is made from rice. With the loan of 1,200,000 KHR, Nan will purchase rice for her husband to keep as a raw material in producing Khmer noodle. She said that her living will be better through using the loan from our lenders. She is very thankful.

loans.use: to purchase rice for her husband to keep as a raw material in producing Khmer noodle.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es: Ernestina, de 47 años, una mujer sencilla, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Emiliano de 61 años  y sus 05 queridos hijos, a quienes brinda amor y buen bienestar. Ernestina, se dedica en los deberes de su hogar mientras que con la ayuda de su esposo puede emplear los trabajos del campo donde cultiva plantas de cacao. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de peones para poder extraer rápido sus frutos  para luego ser compradas por las sociedades de acopio. Ernestina considera que la buena  producción que obtiene es gracias al esmero y cuidado de sus plantaciones. Mas adelante espera en comprar nuevas tierras y poder incrementar plantas de cacao; por otra parte lo ahora prevalece es fumigar sus plantas de las plagas de insectos que aparecen luego de las lluvias. Este será su crédito numero 08 con MFP y agradece por la confianza que le dan para que pueda seguir con sus objetivos. En su banco comunal es puntual en las reuniones y esta al tanto de todo su grupo. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar insecticidas para evitar las plagas que aquejan su siembra.
texts.en: Ernestina is 47 years old. She is a humble woman who lives in her own house with her husband Emiliano, who is 61, and their 5 beloved children, to whom they offer live and wellbeing. Ernestina works at the household duties and with her husband's help con work in the field where she plants cacao. At harvest time she has the help of some laborers in order to get the product out faster to later sell in the wholesalers' center. Ernestina thinks that good production comes from hard work and care for her plantings. In the future, she hopes to buy more land and be able to increase her cacao plants. On the other hand, now she has to fumigate her plants against the insect pests that show up after the rains.This will be loan number 8 with MFP and she is thankful for the trust that they give her so that she can attain her goals. She goes on time to her communal bank's meetings and she is up to date on what is happening in the group. With the 2,000 neuvos soles, she will be able to buy insecticides to avoid the pests that can destroy her crop.

loans.use: to buy insecticide for insects.

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru: Абдусалом трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Он женат и ответственный отец двоих детей. Последние 20 лет он занимается откормом скота. С детства помогал родителям, ведь его отец занимался скотоводством. Также он работает охранником на железнодорожном вокзале. А в свободное время занимается предоставлением услуг такси на личном автомобиле. Абдусалом хотел бы получить займ для покупки крупного рогатого скота для развития своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Abdusalom is a hardworking and kind person. He is married and is a responsible father of two children. For the last 20 years, he has raised livestock. Since he was a child, he helped his parents and his father also raised livestock. Abdusalom also works as a security guard at a railway station. In his spare time, he uses his private car to provide taxi services. Abdusalom would like to receive a loan in order to purchase cattle to grow his business.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary Wanjiku is a 52-year-old restaurant owner in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. She is married. Her business has been in operation for the past four years successfully.

This is her second borrowing from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase more assorted drinks and food stuffs for her restaurant. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and expand her business further.

She hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more assorted drinks and food stuffs for sale

loans.name: Edgard

texts.es:
Edgard, de 29 años es un joven muy alegre y luchador, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Mariluz de 25 años y sus 02 queridos hijos; Jhonat de 07 años y Aldair de 03 años,  a quienes desean brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Durante 20 años Edgard, se dedico a la actividad agrícola; empezó ayudando a sus padres y ahora que tiene su familia pues llego a comprarse un terreno donde pueda plantar cacao.
 Asegura que es rentable por cada kilogramo que se llega a vender depende de la producción, es por eso que  se dedico a sembrar cacao en sus campos y ansiosamente espera los buenos resultados ya que siempre está permanente en su trabajo. Por tal motivo acude a los bancos de MFP para solicitar un préstamo en la puedan ayudar con sus planes de trabajo, es decir, que gracias al crédito que le faciliten podrá realizar el mantenimiento de sus sembrios. Este será su crédito numero 03 con MFP, se siente contento por el apoyo  que le brindan ya que de esa manera seguirá con su objetivo. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, podrá contratar jornaleros para que le ayuden a desyerbar y pasteurizar sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
At 29 years old, Edward is a very happy, tenacious young man. He lives in his own house with his wife Mariluz, who is 25, and their two children, 7-year-old Jhonat and 3-year-old Aldair, to whom they want to give the very best in life. Edward has made a living in agriculture for twenty years. He began by helping his parents, and now that he has his family he has purchased a plot of land where he can plant cacao. 

He makes sure that each kilogram of cacao he sells is profitable, and he depends on what he produces. That's why he decided to make a living planting cacao on his lands, and he anxiously awaits a good outcome, since he is always working. For that reason, he turned to the MFP banks to ask for a loan that would help him with his work plans. In other words, thanks to the loan they gave him he can maintain his crops. 

This will be his third loan with MFP, and he is very happy for the support they gave him, since this way he will continue towards his goal. With the 2,000 nuevos soles, he will hire day laborers that can help him weed and pasteurize his plantations.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Bihomida

texts.ru: Бихомида занимается купле- продажей женской одежды. Она замужем и имеет единственного сына.  Муж пенсионер. Она сама содержит свою семью. Более 20 лет она торгует на рынке. Закупает товар в Бишкеке  и сама ездит за товаром. Бихомида хотела бы получить займ для покупки женской одежды. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Bihomida has a business selling women's clothing. She is married and has one son. Her husband is retired and Bihomida is the sole earner for her family. She has sold at the market for over 20 years. She purchases goods in Bishkek, traveling there herself. Bihomida has requested a loan to purchase more women's clothes to sell. She hopes for your help and generosity.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Luka

texts.en: Luka is 59 years old, married to Esther and they are blessed with four children aged 29, 27, 25 and 23 years old, respectively. He owns a posho (grain) mill and is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to buy bags of maize for sale.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize for sale in his posho mill.

loans.name: Gleyna

texts.en:
Gleyna is 28 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Gleyna has a fishing business in the Philippines. Gleyna requested a 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other materials for fishing.

Gleyna has been in this business for three years. In the future, Gleyna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. Lucia is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Lucia requested a 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her business.

Lucia has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Lucia would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Benazeth

texts.en:
Benazeth is 33 years old and widowed with three children aged 13, 10 and eight years respectively. She has been in the grocery business for three years and is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase more fruit, vegetables and cereals for sale. 

Profit she makes from her business would aid her in enhancing her business to a wholesale store. This is her first loan. Her dream is to provide her children with a good education and fulfill their basic needs as well as to exploit other business opportunities.

loans.use: To purchase fruit, vegetables and cereals such as green grams, maize and beans.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 23 years old. She is a single lady with one child. She has been in the tailoring business for nine months. She generates a monthly income of KES 6,000.

Caroline will be using the loan to purchase more cloth for making dresses for her business and the anticipated profits will be used to expand the business.

This is her sixth loan from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying the previous. Her dream is to prosper in life.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of cloth for making dresses

loans.name: Adonis

texts.en:
Adonis is married with seven children. Adonis is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Adonis plants, harvests and sells corn for a living. He has been doing this for 20 years, and every month he earn 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from this work. He has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

Adonis been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, Adonis hopes for his children to finish their studies and to gain double the income from his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is requesting PHP 29,500.00 through NWTF to purchase an additional pumpboat for her business for her fishing business.

Editha has been in this business for 30 years. Editha earns an additional income from running a small general store and raising pigs.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an additional pumpboat for her fishing business

loans.name: Enecita

texts.en:
Enecita, age 40, is a farmer. She grows and harvests corn and bananas for a living. She has been doing this for 14 years and every month she earns PhP 3,000 from this work. She has requested a loan in the amount of 6,000.00 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Enecita and her husband have five children.

Enecita been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Enecita hopes to provide for the completion of her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure for her farm

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel is from Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 38 years old and married. To make a living, Arnel provides motor transport services. Arnel has been engaged in his business for 3 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP per month. 

In 2009, Arnel joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arnel is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle in order to provide better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle in order to provide better service

loans.name: Angel

texts.en: Angel is from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 47, married, and has two children. Angel used his last loan to repair a transport vehicle used in his business. His business is successful, and he is taking a new loan to purchase additional vehicle spare parts. In the future he hopes to be able to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Nun

texts.en:
In the Baray district of Kompong Tom province, many Cambodians prefer agribusiness to other businesses. The most common businesses are crops and animals husbandry and fishing. One among them, Mrs. Nun, age 41, is in the business of raising hogs and selling fish. She often sells the fish that are caught by her husband from a local river.  She has been blessed with 4 children, all of whom are students and who always share their time helping the family after school.

Mrs. Nun is applying for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase materials for farming such as bean seeds and fertilizer and to pay for a laborer to plow the field. Nun hopes to pursue a comfortable living someday through her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase materials for farming, such as bean seeds and fertilizer and to pay for a laborer to plow the field.

loans.name: Eleta

texts.en:
Eleta is a 51-year-old married woman with 3 children. She and her husband are both farmers. They till land in their hometown in Trinidad, Bohol. Eleta said they have been growing rice for 20 years. They sell their harvest at the market and this earns them about 5000 PHP per month.

Eleta has requested this loan to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor. Eleta hopes this loan will help improve their farming business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es:
Maria tiene 37 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos los cuales son menores de edad, actualmente es separada de su conyugue, cuenta con casa propia. Maria vive en el anexo Los Valdera del Caserío Santa Isabel, a una distancia aproximada de 25 Minutos del Distrito de Morrope,  distrito que esta ubicado a unas 2 horas de la Provincia de Lambayeque.

Maria se dedica específicamente a la crianza y venta de ganado, los cuales negocia cada quincena, para la crianza y mantenimiento de su ganado ha implementado en espacio en la parte posterior de su vivienda, Maria alimenta diariamente a su ganado con polvillo, maíz, purina, etc, alimentos que los compra de manera semanal y al por mayor.
Por la zona donde vive Maria los pobladores acostumbran producir y vender chicha de jora, actividad la cual no escapa de sus manos para ella y la cual le permite generar un ingreso diario para el sustento de su familia.

Maria cuenta con muy poco capital de trabajo por que siempre ha necesitado de un capital mayor para incrementar su negocio comprando mas animales, debido a que por la zona donde vive es un negocio muy común entre los pobladores. Por lo que esta solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de de 1000 Nuevos Soles que ayuden a lograr sus objetivos. 

Maria es una mujer bastante trabajadora y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para sacar adelante a sus hijos los cuales están aun en edad escolar. En la Zona donde vive es muy respetada y considerada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Maria is 37 years old and has four dependent children.  She is currently separated from her husband and owns her own home.  Maria lives in Los Valdera, in the village of Santa Isabel, approximately 25 minutes from Morrope district, which is two hours from Lambayeque province.

Maria raises and sells livestock which she trades every two weeks.  She has set up a space behind her home where she raises and cares for her animals.  Maria feeds her livestock every day with powdered feed, corn, Purina etc.  She buys the feed wholesale every week.  

In the area where Maria lives, the locals produce and sell 'chicha de jora' (a traditional drink).  This is a business which Maria is also engaged in and it allows her to make a daily income with which to support her family.

Maria has very little working capital and she has always needed more capital so that she can increase her business by purchasing more animals.  Where she lives, this is a very common business activity.  She is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 1,000 soles so that she can achieve her aims.

Maria is a hard-working and responsible woman.  Her greatest wish is to continue working so that she can provide for her school-age children.  She is very well respected and well thought of by her neighbors.

loans.use: to buy animals to increase her business

loans.name: Yofanny

texts.es:
Yofanny tiene de 29 años de edad vive en casa propia con su conyugue y sus 3 hijos. Su  casa está ubicada en el Caserío Cruce de Vega una de las tantas zonas rurales comprendidas dentro del distrito de Tambogrande de la provincia de Piura la cual esta ubicada a unas 3 horas aproximadamente de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Yofanny se dedica a la crianza y posterior venta de ganado porcino y aves de corral, esta actividad la viene realizando aproximadamente ya 2 años en unión a su conyugue y sus hijos. Cuenta con corrales apropiados y espaciosos instalados en su propio domicilio. Los porcinos y aves son criados y alimentados desde muy pequeños hasta que alcanzan el tamaño y peso ideal para ser comercializados en el mercado local y compradores de otros zonas. Su conyugue adicionalmente al negocio de animales también se dedica a la agricultura lo que le genera ingresos diarios para el sustento de su familia.

Yofanny con el deseo de seguir  creciendo en su negocio y sacar adelante a su familia desea comprar mas animales y a la vez alimento para el sustento de los mimos, por lo que solicita a Edpyme Alternativa por segunda vez un crédito de 600 Nuevos Soles. 

Yofanny es una mujer responsable y de buen carácter es muy respetada y considerada por los vecinos de la zona donde vive.
texts.en:
Yofanny is 29 years old.  She lives in her own home together with her husband and three children.  Her house is located in the small village of Cruce de Vega, one of many rural areas within Tambogrande district, in Piura province.  It is approximately three hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Yofanny raises and sells pigs and farmyard birds.  She has been in this business for approximately two years together with her husband and her children.  She has suitable and spacious pens which are located on her property.  She raises and feeds her pigs and birds from the time they are very young up until when they have reached an ideal size and weight, at which point she sells them in the local market and to buyers in other areas.  In addition to working in their animal business, her husband also farms which makes him daily income with which he supports the family.

Yofanny would like to continue growing in her business and providing for her family.  She would like to buy more animals and feed for them.  For this reason, she is requesting her second loan from Edpyme Alternativa, for 600 soles.

Yofanny is a responsible woman of good character.  She is very well respected and well thought of by her neighbors.

loans.use: to buy more animals and feed for them

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora, age 63, sells home use products to members of the local community. Teodora been in this business for eight years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. She is a widow and has five children. She is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

In 2010, Teodora joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. Teodora has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan in the amount of 9,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional home use products to offer for sale

loans.name: Munkhtaivan

texts.en: Mr. Munkhtaivan, 30, is a taxi driver around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running his business for a year. He lives with his family in the slum district of the city. Munkhtaivan needed some money to repair some damage to his taxi and to change old spare parts. It is important to his service quality and customers' satisfaction. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchase necessary spare parts for his taxicab repair.

loans.use: To purchase necessary spare parts for his taxicab repair.

loans.name: Erdenedelger

texts.en:
Mrs. Erdenedelger, age 38, runs a second-hand clothes stall in a bazaar, located in a boundary district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running her business for seven years and has gained many customers. She buys her clothing items from suppliers who bring them from the Eastern European developing countries at a low price. 

Now she wants to increase her working capital so as to expand her sales volume. It is a beneficial and important thing to her business future. The loan she is taking out will be dedicated to purchasing second-hand clothes from her supplier in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothes from her supplier in bulk.

loans.name: Los Reyes Magos Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formo por medio de que algunas integrantes ya estaban dentro del programa de comité, decidieron formar uno dentro de su comunidad e invitaron a sus vecinas y amigas dentro de su comunidad. Y de esa manera se inicia el grupo. El comité actualmente se encuentra en el primer ciclo del programa y su meta es poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa de la fundación.
La Sra Herminia tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y junto a su marido tienen 2 hijos. Ella nos cuenta que es manicurista, y que gracias a su buen trabajo ha logrado tener una buena cantidad de clientes. Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo honesta.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de esmaltes, limas de uñas, removedor de esmaltes y demás insumos para seguir con su trabajo. Ella agradece por la oportunidad de progreso que ha recibido.
texts.en:
This committee was set up by some of its members who were already working within the committee program.  They decided to form a committee within their community and invited their neighbors and friends to join.  This is how the group was started.  The committee members are currently in their first loan cycle within the program and their goal is to reach the maximum level of the program.

Herminia is 26 years old.  She is married and she and her husband have two children.  She tells us that she is a manicurist and that, thanks to her good work, she has managed to gain a good number of customers.  She describes herself as a very hard-working person who is, above all, honest.

Herminia is requesting this loan to buy nail polish, nail files, nail polish remover and other supplies so that she can continue in her work.  She is grateful for the opportunity to make progress that she has been given.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, nail files, nail polish remover and other supplies

loans.name: Oleg

texts.ru:
Олег с супругой и 3-летней дочкой живет в селе Гладковка, Херсонской области. Он занимается выращиванием ранних сельхозкультур в тепличных условиях. На 50 сотках земли Олег ежегодно выращивает 3 тонны редиса, 3 000 кустов помидор, 2 000 кустов огурцов, 20 000 голов капусты и 10 тонн картофеля. Олег занимается фермерством уже 4 года. В хозяйство он уже вложил около 60 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль составляет около 5 000 гривен. 

Олег планирует вложить кредит КИВА в размере 20 000 гривен в закупку удобрений на 3 000 гривен, пленки на 6 000 гривен, семян на 4 000 гривен, агроволокна на 2 000 гривен, а также приобрести дуги для теплиц на сумму 2 000 гривен, установить отопление в тех теплицах, где это нужно на 2 000 гривен и отремонтировать одну из теплиц. Все это поможет ему подготовиться к наступающему сезону и получить неплохую прибыль за счет своевременных урожаев и оптовых продаж. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Oleg, his wife and their three-year-old daughter live in the village of Gladkovka, Kherson region. Oleg grows vegetables in greenhouses. On 50 ares of land, he grows 3 tons of radishes, 3000 tomato plants, 2000 cucumber plants, 20,000 heads of cabbage and 10 tons of potatoes annually. Oleg has been farming for four years and has invested approximately 60,000 Ukrainian hryvnias into his business. His profit is approximately 5,000 hryvnias. Oleg plans to invest his Kiva loan of 20,000 hryvnias into the purchase of fertilizer (3000 hryvnias), plastic sheeting (6000 hryvnias), seeds (4000 hryvnias), and protective covering materials (2000 hryvnias). He also plans to purchase structural materials for the greenhouses (2000 hryvnias), install heating in these greenhouses (2000 hryvnias) and repair one of his greenhouses. This will help him prepare for the coming season and earn a decent profit on his own harvest and wholesale orders.

loans.use: to purchase needed items for the planting season and repair his greenhouses

loans.name: Saranchimeg

texts.en: Mrs. Saranchimeg, 47, sells soft home furniture such as sofas and armchairs in a bazaar. She has been running her business for six years and lives with her family in a ger (a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent). For the last few years, her business has been running not so beneficially, and sometimes she bears a loss from her sales. Therefore, she decided to start her own new business in intercity passenger transportation. She has three years of experience as a driver, as she used to drive a taxi around the city before she started her sales business. Now she needs some money to support the purchase of a minivan to use for starting her new business. The loan she is taking will be used to cover the cost of a new minivan for her new business.

loans.use: to cover the cost of a new minivan for her new business.

loans.name: Enkhbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhbaatar, 45, is a taxi driver around the Kherlen, a boundary town. He lives with his son and wife in an old house located in the slum district. Just a year ago, he started his taxi business and he already has a lot of permanent customers. 

In the last several years, his house has become very bad with damage to every part of it.  Therefore he is taking a loan to purchase some building materials to make adjustments to his old house before this cold winter.
