loans.use: To purchase the some building materials to make an adjustment to his old house before this cold winter.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes, age 61 and widowed, is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She operates a variety store business. Lourdes works  hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses. Her children help her to maintain the household while she runs her store, which is adjacent to her house.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns her income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this business, she also prepares and sells cooked viands for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in income as she expands her business. 

Lourdes dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a gospel musician and songwriter and has been in the music industry for the past 20 years. She is 39 years of age and widowed, with school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of video compact disks (VCDs) and DVDs so that she can produce and record her songs and make them available in the market for purchase, allowing her to make more income and providing better living standards for her family.

In the future, Ruth hopes to open her own production studio and a music store as well as give opportunity for other upcoming musicians to record and produce their songs. She also hopes to become an international musician.

loans.use: To buy more stock  of video compact disks (VCDs) and DVDs

loans.name: Silvana

texts.es: Silvana de 28 años de edad. de estado civil  soltera y tiene una hija de 4 años de edad; En sui vida diaria genera ingresos a partir de su negocio de reciclaje, el cual inició desde el año 2011. Ella como ingeniera industrial trabajó en una empresa dedicada al reciclaje, pero se enfermó y tuvo que asumir una incapacidad y posteriormente su retiro laboral. Como en su  época  de educación universitaria estudió lo concerniente al reciclaje y su proyecto de grado versó en ese tema, cuando quedó desempleada recurrió nuevamente a su proyecto de comprar   material reciclable a las grandes industrias, para posteriormente venderlo a empresas recicladoras y dedicadas a la transformación del cartón, PVC, pegadiza, pasta, plásticos etc. Hoy su sueño es hacer crecer cada vez más su negocio y construirle a su madre una hermosa  casa, además de potenciarle un futuro exitoso a su hija. Su meta a mediano plazo es comprar maquinas para procesar ella misma el material, porque su mayor desafío es la competencia que crea una gran presión en el merado en el que se desenvuelve.   Mientras esto ocurre su rotación de cuentas por cobrar es de 1 día, mientras sus inventarios rotan cada 3 y desde estos indicadores financieros desea hacer crecer su negocio. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen, materias primas como cartón, plástico, cuerdas, su inversión sería exitosa porque está negociando bajo un precio de oportunidad, con ello obtendrá una mayor rentabilidad y una mayor ganancia.
texts.en: 28-year-old Silvana is single and has a four-year-old daughter.  Every day she makes income from her recycling business which she set up in 2011.  As an industrial engineer, she used to work for a recycling company but she became sick.  She had to take sick leave and then leave her job.  As she had studied recycling during her time at University, and her dissertation was on this topic, when she became unemployed she decided to start buying recyclable material from big industries which she then sold on to recycling companies and companies that recycle cardboard, PVC, paper, plastics, etc.  Her current dream is to further grow her business and to build her mother a beautiful house.  She also dreams of giving her daughter the opportunity to enjoy a successful future.  Her medium-term goal is to buy machines so that she can process the material herself because her biggest challenge is the competition which creates a lot of pressure in the market in which she works.  While she works towards achieving this goal, Silvana's accounts receivable turnover period is one day and her stock turnover period is three days.  It is based on these financial indicators that she would like to grow her business.  This is why she has applied for a Kiva loan (her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo).  She will use it to buy raw materials such as cardboard, plastic and rope in larger quantities.  Her investment will be successful because she is negotiating at a good price.  This will make her business more profitable and make her more profits.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as cardboard, plastic and rope in bulk

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
This is Elena, 57, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a widow and mother to her three children.With her children, she manages the household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Elena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal in the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 pesos worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she also sells cooked viand for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elena dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma, age 62, operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other materials for the home. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of PhP 400 in sales every day. She and her children manage the household while she operates the business. Her husband Maximo is a carpenter. The family lives in Pasay City, Philippines. Lerma works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PhP 16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Lerma hopes her business continues to grow and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like fabric, thread, and other items needed in her tailoring business

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti is 24 years old, married and the mother of three children. She owns rental houses in Malindi town and has been in the business for the last 17 years. She earns a monthly profit of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

Siti was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our credit officers, and she is applying for her first loan of 100,000 KES. She intends to use this loan to repair one of her houses as well as pay school fees for her son. She will save the anticipated profit from her houses to help take care of her children. In the future, Siti hopes to grow her business and also intends to venture into other businesses.

loans.use: to repair one of her houses as well as pay school fees for her son

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado San Blas surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la Fundación,  el grupo se encuentra en el 4 ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2011. Ellas son mujeres jefas de hogar que se esfuerzan al máximo para poder dar a sus familias lo mejor.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Hilda quien esta acompañada con el Sr. Oscar quien es mecánico, con el tiene 2 hijos. Ella se dedica hace varios años a la confección de ropas de todo tipo y cuenta que gracias a esto ella puede ayudar a su marido con los gastos del día a día y a la mantención de los hijos y de la casa. Dice que su mayo sueño es que sus hijos estudien una carrera universitaria y sean personas de bien.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, cierres y demás insumos necesarios para pode continuar con la confección de prendas que hace.
texts.en:
This group, called 'San Blas', was created when one of its members contacted Fundación Paraguaya.  The group are in their fourth loan cycle and have been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 2011.  They are all heads of household who work as hard as they can to provide their families with the best.

One of the members of this group is Hilda.  She lives with Oscar, who is a mechanic, and the couple have two children.  Hilda has been making all kinds of clothing for several years now.  She says that, thanks to her work, she is able to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses and also support her children and their home.  She says that her biggest dream is for her children to study for a college degree and become upstanding citizens.

Hilda is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, fasteners and other supplies she needs to continue making clothes.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, adhesive, fasteners, etc.

loans.name: Alternativas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALTERNATIVAS” iniciará su vigésimo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Angélica. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de cuadros, venta de batidos, venta de medias, venta de artículos varios, venta de linternas y varios, venta de ropa de bebe.

La señora Angélica,  indica que es el primer año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una de sus compañeras. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de batidos (productos energéticos)) que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de un trabajo anterior.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de bebidas para la preparación de sus productos) que adquirirá la agencia distribuidora, por mayor, y posterior a la elaboración lo venderá en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los créditos.
texts.en:
The “ALTERNATIVAS” community bank are about to start their 28th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional office.  The group has eight members and is run by a board of directors which is headed by Angélica.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include: selling paintings, selling shakes, selling socks, selling miscellaneous goods, selling flashlights and miscellaneous goods and selling baby clothes.

Angélica tells us that this is the first year she has worked with Pro Mujer.  She joined through an invitation from one of her friends.  She has a business selling shakes (energy products).  She has been working in this business for years and learned the trade from a previous job.

Angélica is taking out a loan to increase her capital, buying drinks for preparing her products.  She will acquire these wholesale from her distributor and then, after preparing them, she will sell them from her sales location.  This work allows her to make income with which to support her family.  She is single and has two children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Angélica replied that she likes the loans.

loans.use: to buy drinks for preparing her products

loans.name: Mariya

texts.ru:
Мария замужем, у нее трое детей. Она живет в городе Тячево. Мария торгует на рынках своего городка женской одеждой больших размеров. Обычно найти подобную одежду не так просто, поэтому Мария специально закупает соответствующий товар для людей нестандартной комплектации и привозит его для реализации в своем городе. Конкуренция как таковая в работе Марии отсутствует. Товар пользуется спросом, есть своя клиентура. Торговое место – хорошее. Работает в этой сфере уже 5 лет.  На данный момент в товаре у Марии 35 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль составляет 6 200 гривен.  

Марии необходим кредит в размере 12 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить качественный товар в Черновцах и пополнить оборотные средства. Мария планирует и в дальнейшем развивать свой бизнес, улучшать условия проживания и по возможности помогать детям финансово. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Mariya is married and has three children. She lives in the city of Tyachevo. Mariya sells large-size women's clothing at the market in her town. It's not easy to find larger sizes locally, so she specially purchases clothing for people who need these sizes and brings the goods back to her town to sell. Mariya does not have competition in her market. There is a demand and clientele for the goods she sells. Mariya's shop is in a good location and she has been in business for five years. Currently, Mariya has 35,000 Ukrainian hryvnias (UAH) in inventory. Her profit is 6,2000 hryvnias. Mariya needs a loan of 12,000 hryvnias to purchase quality goods in Chernovtsi and increase her working assets. In the future, Mariya plans to grow her business, improve her living conditions and help her children financially if she can.

loans.use: to purchase quality goods in Chernovtsi and increase her working assets

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is 20 years old. He lives in Ijevan with his big family: his father, mother, brother, sister-in-low and nephew. Samvel’s parents work at a woodworking complex. 
Samvel is studying at Yerevan State University, Ijevan branch, and at the same time he runs his own household goods and toy trading business in a rented shop. When Samvel was serving in the Armenian army, his mother and brother ran the business in his absence. Now they continue helping Samvel in his occupation. Samvel buys merchandise from distributors and also once a month from wholesale markets in Yerevan. Thanks to his trading, Samvel is able to pay for his education at the University and to provide for his family as well. 
Samvel is seeking a 1.000.000 AMD loan to buy a large lot of basins, pails, detergents, etc. for his business.

loans.use: to buy large lot of basins, pails, detergents, etc. for his business

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
This is Mercedes, 55, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother of two children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, Mercedes is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mercedes operates a BBQ stall. She regularly buys pork, meat and chicken entrails that she prepare to cook and sell in the afternoon at her barbeque stand near her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Mercedes is requesting a Php14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy supplies like pork, meat and chicken needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Mercedes dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies needed in her food stall business.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma, who works hard to support her family, is married and has operated a tailoring business in the Philippines for four years now. She is requesting a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more tools and other materials for her sewing machine. In the future, Wilma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more tools and other materials for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Chombo

texts.en:
Chombo age 49, is a carpenter. He lives with his wife and their four children in Mariakani. His business has been in operation for the past 22 years. 

This marks the third loan Chombo has taken out from KADET Ltd. to finance his business. With the loan, he plans to purchase timber, nails, a hammer, and planes.

He will use the anticipated profits to provide for the education of his children and repay his loan. He hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase timber, nails, a hammer, and planes for his construction business

loans.name: Marie Bernadette

texts.en:
Marie, a 51-year-old single mother of three children, one of whom is in school, also supports her granddaughter and nephew. Marie sells bed sheets, blankets, women's clothing, bags, shoes, and men's shirts in a local market in Brazzaville. She started her business a year ago selling only bed sheets, blankets, and clothing, but because she now has access to capital, she has expanded her products to bags and shoes as well. Marie realizes the importance of good customer service and works hard to make her customers feel respected and well-served.

The recipient of two previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo, both repaid in full and on time, Marie is excited to take her third and largest loan because this will enable her to increase the amount and variety of products she offers. She hopes to one day build a house for her family and be able to travel abroad.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing, men's shirts, bags, and shoes.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para invertir en su puesto de comida, el dinero lo utilizara en carnes, camarones, pescado, conchas, condimentos, aceite y gaseosas, todo esto es necesario para el buen funcionamiento del comedor.
Ella considera que el efecto que tuvo en el negocio con la utilidad del préstamo, ha sido muy buena, ya que le dio fortaleza, su familia tambien ha progresado junto a ella.
texts.en: Sandra has decided to take out a new loan to invest in her food business.  She will use the money to buy meat, shrimp, fish, shellfish, condiments, oil and soda which she needs for the smooth running of her eatery.  She believes that the effect her previous loan had on her business was very positive as it gave her strength.  Her family have also made progress alongside her.

loans.use: to buy meat, shrimp, fish, shellfish, condiments, oil and soda

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo por la época escolar, además quiere instalar la energía al chalet, por eso solicita dicho préstamo que le ayude a cubrir este costo de instalación, los productos para el negocio que va a comprar son carnes, refrescos, boquitas, condimentos, pan, para elaborar comida rápida los estudiantes.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para mejorar el negocio, las ganancias aumentaron y su familia está en mejores condiciones, ya que sus hijos han avanzado a otro año escolar.
texts.en: Vicenta has decided to take out a new loan for the upcoming back-to-school season.  She would also like to install electricity in her house.  For her business, she will buy meat, soft drinks, snacks, herbs and spices and bread so that she can make fast food for the students.  She believes that her previous loan helped her to improve her business.  Her profits increased and her family have improved their conditions as her children have completed another school year.

loans.use: to buy meat, soft drinks, snacks, herbs and spices, and bread

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es:
Blanca, se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo préstamo, ya que está por iniciar las labores agrícolas con su familia, ella comprara los insumos como abono, herbicidas, semilla mejorada, para tener todo listo e iniciar la siembra.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho, sus cultivos fueron sanos y muy productivos.
texts.en:
Blanca has decided to request a new loan because she is about to begin her agricultural labor with her family.  She will buy supplies such as fertilizer, herbicide, and improved seed to have everything ready and begin the planting.

She considers that the previous loan helped her a lot.  Her crops were healthy and very productive.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and improved seed.

loans.name: Roman

texts.ru:
Роман женат, имеет двое маленьких детей. Он занимается строительным бизнесом - производит ремон домов, квартир офисов и пр. помещений. Свой бизнес Роман начал 5 лет назад. До этого он работал охранником, потом менеджером, потом решил что нужно начинать работать на себя. Он приобрел минимум оборудования и начал работать сам, затем создал бригаду из 2-3 человек и работал вместе с ними. В данным момент он управляет бригадой наемных работников, которые выполняют работы под его руководством.

Роман просит предоставтиь кредит в сумме 20,000 гривен для приобретения строительного оборудования - двух бетономешалок. Оборудование поможет ему ускорить ремонтные работы, а значит и увеличить доход.

Роман - заботливый семьянин, хороший друг, надеждый партнер для своих клиентов. В людях он ценит такие качества, как честность, предприимчивость и верность. Роман ухаживает на пожилой сестрой своей матери, которая осталось одна и нудждается в уходе.
texts.en: Roman is married and has two small children. He has a construction business repairing and renovating homes, apartments, offices and other places. Roman started his business five years ago. Prior to this he worked as a security guard and then as a manager before deciding that he needed to go into business for himself. He acquired the minimum equipment needed and began working alone, then recruited 2-3 others to work with him. Currently he manages a team of workers who complete jobs under his direction. Roman requests a loan of 20,000 Ukrainian hryvnias (UAH) to purchase construction equipment, specifically two cement mixers. This equipment will help him complete jobs more quickly, increasing the income of his business. Roman is a caring family man, a good friend and a trusted partner to his clients. In people he values qualities such as honesty, initiative, and loyalty. Roman also cares for his mother's elderly sister, who is alone and needs help.

loans.use: to purchase equipment

loans.name: Lesya

texts.ru:
Леся замужем, имеет двоих детей. Она торгует на рынке одеждой, а также в посадочный сезон семенами. Раньше работала на заводе. Пять лет назад завод перестал работать и Лесю сократили. С тех пор она работает на себя, обеспечивая свою семью необходимым - продуктами и одеждой.

Торговая точка Леси расположена на продуктовом рынке, где всегда много людей. Более того, Леся ставит небольшую наценку на товар и зарабатывает за счет большего оборота. Поэтому бизнес Леси идет успешно, клиентов всегда много.

Леся просит предоставить ей кредит в размере 10,000 гривен на покупку семян для продажи. Поздняя зима и весна - оличный период для этого бизнеса. Леся надеется получить дополнительную прибыль и улучшить благосостояние своей семьи.
texts.en:
Lesya is married and has two children. She sells clothing at the market and also sells seeds during the planting season. Previously she worked at a factory. Five years ago the factory closed and Lesya was laid off. Since then she has been her own boss, providing her family with their basic needs - food and clothing. 

Lesya's shop is located at a food market where there are always a lot of people. She also puts a small markup on the goods she sells and makes money due to her high sales volume. For this reason, her business is successful and she has a lot of clients. 

Lesya requests a loan of 10,000 Ukrainian hryvnias (UAH) to purchase seeds for resale. Late winter and spring is an excellent time for this type of business. Lesya hopes to make an additional profit and improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for resale

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew has been running a retail business whereby he sells shoes, bags and clothes at wholesale prices to his customers, for four years. He earns a monthly profit of KES. 6,000. He is married to Esther, and they have one child who is two years old.
Andrew has applied for his first loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to use the loan amount to buy shoes, bags and clothes for sale.  Andrew will use the anticipated profits to provide for the basic needs of his family and to grow his business and open a big wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy shoes, bags and clothes.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee is a widow and has a beach cottages business in the Philippines. Haydee has been in this business for 10 years now.  She works hard to support her family.

Haydee requested a PHP13000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for maintenance of her cottages.  In the future, Haydee would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for maintenance of her cottages

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.en:
Brigitte, age 49, is a single mother with two school age children. She also cares and provides for her elderly mother. 
She sells cloth and material for men's and women's clothes in a local market in Brazzaville. She has had this business for five years and has gained a loyal customer base. 
Brigitte believes good customer service is most important to her business' success. She strives to offer her clients the best products and service. Her major difficulty is the lack of consistent business sales. Some weeks she does very well and then other weeks she doesn't sell enough. 

Brigitte has successfully taken two loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo, and has repaid in full and on time. She is anxious to take her third loan because the loan allows her to buy a large variety of cloth. She hopes to eventually become a supplier and travel abroad to buy cloth and material. As her business continues to grow with the help of the loans, she hopes to be able to build a house and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for cloth and material for dressmaking.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has been selling natural medicines in the Philippines for 30 years. She earns additional income from clothing sales.

Now requesting a loan of PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy more natural medicines to sell to her customers, Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more natural medicines to sell.

loans.name: Estrelia

texts.en:
Estrelia, age 55, is a vendor of fruits and vegetables. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur and has operated her business for six years. Estrelia and her husband have five children, two of whom are still in school.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fruits and vegetables to offer for sale in her food stall.

In the future, Estrelia would like to save enough money so as to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
El señor Dionisio es de la ciudad e Encarnación, está casado y tiene 3 hijos. El es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora quien se esfuerza por poder dar a su familia todo para que no les falte nada, ya que ellos son su razón de ser.
El se dedica a la fábrica y venta de fundas para autos, (forros para asientos de vehículos) en una rotonda bien concurrida. El comenta que gracias al buen trabajo que hace ha podido generarse una buena cantidad de clientes que siempre acuden hasta el.
Dionisio solicita el crédito para la compra de forros para asientos, fundas para autos, fundas para volantes y demás productos para la venta. El manifiesta que la ayuda de fundación y de Kiva será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Dionisio is from the city of Encarnación.  He is married and has three children.  He is a very hardworking person and a fighter who makes an effort to be able to give his family everything so they do not need anything, because they are his reason for being.

He works making and selling car covers and car seat covers in a very busy traffic circle.  He comments that, thanks to the good work he does, he has been able to generate for himself a good number of customers who always go to him.

Dionisio is requesting the loan to buy seat covers, car covers, steering wheel covers, and other products to sell.  He says that the help from the foundation and Kiva will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy seat covers, car covers, steering wheel covers, and other products.

loans.name: Flor De Papa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE PAPA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Villa Adela, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Vicenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: producción de calzados de cholita, venta de calzados deportivos, venta de fruta, venta de comida, producción de polleras, distribución de cereales.

La señora Vicenta,  indica que hace dos ciclos que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de sus amigas y vecinas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción y venta calzados de cholitas que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de cuero) que adquirirá de la Ceja, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención en salud.
texts.en:
The “FLOR DE PAPA” community bank are about to start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Adela regional office.  The group has six members and is run by a board of directors which is headed by Vicenta.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include: making traditional 'cholita' shoes, selling sports shoes, selling fruit, selling food, making 'polleras' (traditional skirts) and distributing cereals.

Vicenta says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for two loan cycles.  She joined the institution through an invitation from her friends and neighbors.  She currently has a business making and selling traditional 'cholita' shoes which she has been working in for some time.

Vicenta will use her loan to increase her capital.  She will buy leather wholesale in La Ceja and then, after she has made her products, she will sell them to order.  This work allows her to make income with which to support her family.  She is single and has six children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Vicenta replied that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy leather

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia, age 47, sells children's shoes, bed sheets, and women's wraps and dresses in a local market in Brazzaville. She and her husband have seven children, five of whom are currently attending school. 

Patricia has been successfully running her business for 32 years, so she has much experience in running her business and navigating the local markets. She has taken out three loans from Kiva partner HOPE Congo and has repaid them on time and in full. She utilizes the loans well to improve the quality as well as variety of her merchandise. 

Good customer service is one of Patricia's main business strategies. She has managed to grow a large customer base over the past 32 years because of the relationships she has created. She greets her customers with a smile and is always working to serve them better.  

Patricia wishes to continue her business growth and is requesting another loan to apply toward expanding her business. Her dreams for her business are to eventually build a boutique to operate in, as well as to be able travel abroad to buy merchandise from other countries.

loans.use: to purchase children's shoes, bed sheets, and women's wraps and dresses to offer for sale

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
This time Jenelyn is applying for a loan of PHP 23,000 to fund her general store business. The general store business that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide her an additional income for her business. 

Jenelyn wants to expand her business and do some house improvements.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en: This time Maribeth is borrowing PHP 25,000 to fund her general store. The general store and food vending that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continue to provide Maribeth and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is married with four children; three children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Thelma is 32 years old.

Thelma has a general store business in the Philippines. Thelma requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more goods like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

Thelma has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Thelma would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva is 34 years old and has three children; two of the children are in school. She is married.

Oliva is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Oliva requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Oliva would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Juana De Dios

texts.es:
Juana, se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo préstamo, porque quiere comprar una serie de productos para mejorar la salud de los animales de la granja, como vitaminas, desparasitantes, concentrado y harinilla, todo esto para su ganado.
Él considera haber mejorado con la inversión anterior, así como en su familia, considera que han superado y por eso continúa trabajando con la institución.
texts.en: Juana has decided to take out a new loan because she would like to buy a series of products to improve the health of her farm animals such as vitamins, anti-parasitical medicines, concentrated feed and middlings.  She believes that her business improved as a result of her previous loan as did her family situation.  She believes that they have done well and so she continues to work with the institution.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, anti-parasitical medicines, concentrated feed and middlings

loans.name: Floriza

texts.en:
Floriza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her tricycle transportation. Floriza has been in this business for 6 years. She earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing and snack foods.

Floriza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her tricycle transport

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 54 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Merlina is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Merlina has been raising pigs for fifteen years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nancy Nicole

texts.en:
Nancy is a 35-year-old single mother with two teenagers, both in school. She buys bedsheets, curtains and clothes from a wholesaler and sells them in a local market in Brazzaville.

She has had this business for the past five years. She uses the loans to buy many different varieties of cloth in bulk. Sometimes she sells what she finds in the market. Now she has found only the bedsheets and curtains to sell.

Nancy has found that good customer service and an attractive display of cloth is important for the success of her business. She works hard each day to set up and keep the bedsheets, curtains and clothes in an organized and attractive manner. 

She has successfully taken two loans from Kiva's partner HOPE Congo and is excited to continue with the loans. She hopes one day to become a clothes supplier in Brazzaville. The hope that her family will have stability and be happy motivates Nancy to work hard with her business.

loans.use: to pay bedsheets, curtains and clothes.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, age 42, sells children's clothes at a local market in Brazzaville. She has had this business for 16 years. She is the single mother of five children, four of whom are currently enrolled in school.

Josephine has received three loans from Kiva partner HOPE Congo and has repaid them on time and in full. She hopes to continue her business growth and to access loans to expand her business. She wants to eventually become a supplier and to travel abroad to buy products. She uses the profits from her business to improve her family's standard of living. 

As with her previous loans, Josephine will use the current loan to buy children's clothes from a supplier and offering these for sale at her market stand. She believes her business is successful because she sells high-quality clothes. Her customers know that the clothes they buy from her will be durable and long-lasting.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes to offer for sale at her market stand

loans.name: Sostena

texts.en:
Sostena is a married lady, 61 years old, and blessed with two children, aged 38 and 19 years old. Her spouse, Jacob, is a farmer, thus contributing some income to the family. Sostena owns a food store in the Kapsaos trading centre. Her food store has been in operation for a period of twelve years and she earns a monthly income of KES 20,000.

Sostena is requesting a third term loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD after she repaid the previous loans successfully. She wishes to use this amount to purchase dry maize, beans, and millet for resale.

The profits will be used to educate her children and plough back into her business. Her dreams are to prosper in business and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase dry maize, beans, and millet for resale.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is 55 years old. He is married to Rahab and together they have eight children. He is a carpenter and has been in the business for the past one year. He makes a monthly income of 35,000 Kenyan shillings from the business.

Shadrack has received his first loan from KADET Ltd. He was introduced to KADET by a client. He will use this loan to purchase a smoothing machine and wood chisel.

loans.use: to purchase tools like a smoothing machine and wood chisel.

loans.name: Khoren

texts.en:
Khoren is 38 years old. He lives in Ijevan city with his big family, which consists of seven members. Khoren lives with his parents, his wife, two small sons and his brother. Khoren’s wife stays at home and takes care of their children, and his father is a pensioner. Khoren’s mother works as an accountant at the Ijevan road building company, and Khoren works at the same company as a worker. 

Simultaneously with his work at company, Khoren runs his own production business. He and his brother produce building materials in their house's yard. They produce pumice stone blocks, flagstones, stairs, etc., to private orders. Thanks to the business, Khoren and his brother support their big family. 

This is Khoren’s fifth loan from Nor Horizon, and he always does his repayments on time. Now he needs a 1,000,000 Aremian dram (AMD) loan to construct a dryer, which will allow him to dry final products, and thus shorten the period of production.

loans.use: to construct a dryer, which will allow him to dry final products.

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
El Señor Silvio es de la ciudad de Villarrica, tiene 60 años de edad, está Casado, nos cuenta que se dedica a un Taller Mecánico bastante conocido en la Ciudad de Villarrica, por la antigüedad de su servicio.
Estudio y practico la profesión en la ciudad de Buenos Aires, luego regreso al Paraguay y monto su propio Taller Mecánico de Automotriz Gracias a su buen servicio, hoy en día su taller tiene varios convenios con las instituciones  y realiza servicios de reparaciones y mantenimientos en general a los autos.
 El comenta que siempre ha trabajado y que todo lo que hace es por poder dar a su familia el sustento diario, ya que a pesar de ser una persona de edad quiere poder seguir ayudando en la casa.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de aceites lubricantes, lo cual le será de gran ayuda en su taller. Está agradecido con kiva y fundación por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Señor Silvio, aged 60, is married and lives in the city of Villarrica. He told us that he runs a vehicle repair shop in Villarrica and is well known because he has served his customers for ages. He studied and worked in his profession in Buenos Aires, then came back to Paraguay and opened his own Automobile Mechanic Workshop. Thanks to his good service his workshop has secured several contracts with institutions and he performs repair and maintenance services for their cars. Silvio says that he has always worked and that he does it to give his family its daily bread. Despite being an elderly person he wants to continue helping at home.

Silvio applies for the loan to buy lubricating oil, which is much needed in his workshop. He is grateful to Kiva and the microfinance institution Fundación Paraguaya for the provided opportunity.

loans.use: to buy lubricating oil for his workshop and later resale.

loans.name: Marite

texts.en:
Marite is 39 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is in school.  

Marite is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marite has been raising pigs for nine years now, and has borrowed nineteen times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marite would like to save enough money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en: Yvonne is a 23-year-old single lady in the business of cosmetic sales. It is a business she started two years ago. Her monthly income is 35,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She has never borrowed from any other MFI, and she requires a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase perfumes, body lotions and gels, lipsticks and bathing gels. The anticipated profit will enable her to buy a plot and settle in. Her dream is to see her business expand to greater levels. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, body lotions and gels, lipsticks and bathing gels

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: This time Cecilia is borrowing 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to fund her general store business. This general store and a fruit selling business, that were previously funded through NWTF and Kiva, continue to provide Cecilia and her family the opportunity to increase their income and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy grocery stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Synthia-Helena

texts.en:
Synthia, age 29, is the single mother of a four-year-old child and also supports two other family members. She sells cloth and materials for dressmaking at a local market in Brazzaville. She has had this business for four years. 

Synthia finds that good customer service is the best way to increase her sales. She receives each customer with joy and gratitude. Her major difficulty is the increasing market price of the cloth and material she sells.

Synthia has received three loans from Kiva partner HOPE Congo, and hopes to receive a fourth. The previous loans were all paid back in full and on time. She intends to continue to expand her business and plans to use her business profits to ensure stability in her family's life. She also hopes to build a home for her family one day.

loans.use: to buy cloth and dressmaking material

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали более восьми лет занимается животноводством. В основном он разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Ему 31 год. У него четверо детей. Его жена помогает ему в деятельности. Он берет кредит для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Sherali has been raising livestock for over 8 years. For the most part he raises cattle for re-sale. He is 31 and has four children. His wife helps him in his business. Sherali is taking out a loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor Manuel es un emprendedor que desde muy joven inicio su negocio de venta de bloques en el cual aprendió este negocio de la necesidad de generar ingresos a la familia y apoyar en los gastos. Víctor Manuel ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación león 2000, lo cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con muchos sueños en la vida. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en el negocio en la compra de materia prima como cemento, piedrín, arena entre otros materiales.
texts.en: Víctor Manuel is an entrepreneur who from an early age started selling blocks in order to generate earnings to support his family.  Víctor Manuel has received credit from Fundación León 2000, and has proven to be a responsible person with many dreams ahead for his life.  He now seeks credit to invest in his business to buy materials such as cement, stone and other materials.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, stone and other constuction materials

loans.name: Abdurafi

texts.ru: Абдурафи трудолюбивый и добросовестный семьянин. На воспитании имеет четверых детей. Более 15 лет он занимается купле- продажей кураги. В бизнесе занимается один. Кроме этого летом покупает сад абрикосовых деревьев и перерабатывает. Абдурафи хочет улучшить свое жилищные условия и для этого ему нужно расширить свой бизнес. С этой целью он запрашивает займ для покупки кураги, чтобы увеличить оборотных средств.
texts.en: Abdurafi is a hardworking and conscientious family man with four children. For more than 15 years he has been in business buying and selling dried apricots. He is a sole proprietor. In the summertime he also buys an orchard of apricot trees and processes the fruit. Abdurafi hopes to improve his family's living conditions and needs to expand his business to do so. With this goal in mind he has requested a loan to purchase dried apricots, to increase his working assets.

loans.use: To buy dried apricots

loans.name: Giovanna Luz

texts.es:
Giovana  tiene 21 años de edad, ella vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad conocida por su población de origen afroperuano, por sus danzas y es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, por sus hermosas playas y por la producción de nuestro producto Bandera el “Pisco”, también esta ciudad es muy conocida por su comida ya que los pobladores de esa ciudad se les conoce por la buena sazón que tienen por ello uno de los platos que más le gusta es la Sopa Seca y la Carapulcra”; Giovanna no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Administración, ella es madre un precioso pequeño de 1 añito al cual ama mucho y es lo más importante que tiene en la vida nos comenta Giovanna, y por ello ella va luchar cada día para darle lo mejor y sea feliz y sea mejor que ella.

Giovana trabaja en la venta de adornos para el hogar, le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 9 horas diarias y puede llegar a atender hasta 10 clientes diariamente y es que ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con sus clientes, ofrece productos de calidad con facilidad de pago y porque es la única que vende estos productos por su zona.

Giovana está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar más mercadería y con ello tendrá más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, con esta mejora tendra mayores ingresos, mejorara su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Darle una buena calidad de vida a su hijo y una profesión”.
texts.en:
Giovanna is 21 years old.  She lives in Chincha, the cradle of Peru’s sports glories, a city known for its Afro Peruvian population, folk dances, beautiful beaches, and its flag product, “Pisco” (a grape brandy first distilled in Peru).  It is also famous for its cuisine as the residents of this city are known for their good taste in food.  One of the best-loved dishes is “Sopa Seca” (a typical Peruvian dish based in rice, with tomatoes, onions and garlic and cooked in a broth) and “Carapulcra” (a pork and dry-potato stew).  Giovanna has not been able to study for a professional degree but would have liked to study Business Management. She is the mother of a precious little one year old boy, who she loves very much.  Giovana tells us that her son is the most important thing in her life, and she is going to strive each day to give him the best so that he will be happy and better off than she was.  

Giovana sells home décor items and works in her business about nine hours a day.  The number of customers she serves may reach up to ten per day and she believes that her business is going well because she treats her customers well.  She offers quality products, convenient payment plans, and she is the only vendor in her area who sells these products.  

Giovana is very grateful for the Kiva loans.  Thanks to their help, she will be able to buy more merchandise and will have a wider variety of products to offer her customers.  This improvement to her business will enable her to earn higher income, improve her quality of life, and continue striving to fulfill her great dream: “To give her son a better quality of life and the opportunity to have a good profession”.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Lurawisa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LURAWISA” iniciará su vigésimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Celia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de mantas, tienda de barrio, horno industrial y panadería, venta de útiles escolares.

La señora Celia,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de útiles escolares que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de material escolar) que adquiere de La Paz  y posteriormente lo venderá en su domicilio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The A.C. "Lurawisa" began its 20th cycle in the communal bank Pro Mujer as part of the Panamercan focus.   This group is made up of 7 members and is managed by Senora Celia.  The businesses of the various members include small shops, handcrafted table cloths, bakeries, and school supplies.  

Celia has had a business selling school supplies for many years, and this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer, joining through an invitation.  The credit they are requesting will help all the businesses, and Celia will use her share to purchase school supplies in La Paz, which she then sells in her area.  This work enables her to generate income to support her family.  She is married and has 3 children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said it helps her to increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies to sell

loans.name: Izzat

texts.en:
Izzat, age 53, earns an income by gathering used tins and plastics and reselling these for recycling use. It's been 15 years since he started this business, and it is the only source of income for the family. He and his wife have three children.

Izzat's car needs a lot of maintenance in order for him to stay mobile and to improve and expand his sector. Is is why he has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to be able to perform necessary maintenance on his truck.

This is Izzat's twelfth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower with an excellent repayment history. His previous loans have had positive effects on both his social and financial situations.

Izzat hopes he can buy a new truck in the future with the help of Al Majmoua loans.

loans.use: to perform necessary maintenance on his truck

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa, necesita comprarse mercadería para el negocio, por eso está solicitando un préstamo que le permita comprarse carnes, arroz, aceite, pollo, condimentos para mantener surtido el negocio y poder ofrecer más variedad a los clientes.
Ella tuvo un efecto positivo en el uso del préstamo anterior, esto le ha dado mayor fuerza para continuar brindando su servicio en la venta de comida.
texts.en: Rosa needs to buy merchandise for her business and thus seeks credit to buy meat, rice, oil, chicken and spices to maintain an assorted variety of products to offer her clients.  She had great success with a prior credit, which gives her renewed strength to continue offering her services in food sales.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice, oil, chicken, spices.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: Karla Patricia es una emprendedora muy trabajadora toda su vida a trabajando para salir adelante y sobre todo ser independiente tenido su propio negocio donde generar ingresos para la gastos de la familia y poder sacar a su hijo adelante. Karla es una de las cliente de Fundación León 2000, en el cual el crédito otorgado anteriormente compro capital trabajo para  el negocio de las ventas de recargas y frijoles que en su localidad donde ella vive sus cliente la visitan en su casa de habitación. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento en la compra de recargas movistar y claros y frijoles para ofrecerle a su clientes.
texts.en: Karla Patricia is an enterprising and hardworking woman who has worked her whole life.  Above all, she wanted to be independent with her own business, where she could generate income to help her family and provide a good quality of life for her son.  Karla is a member of the Foundation Leon 2000. With her previous loan, she was able to invest in the small shop she runs from her home.  This loan will be used to purchase phone cards for resale, along with ingredients she uses to make snacks for the customers.

loans.use: to purchase phone cards for resales and ingredients for the snacks she sells from her small shop

loans.name: Jose Aquilino

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque está en el proceso de recolección de cosecha de maíz, para ello necesita tener dinero para el pago de los mozos y el transporte de la cosecha hacia su casa.
El manifiesta que su experiencia con el préstamo anterior fue buena, ya que por medio de él obtuvo los insumos para aplicarlos a la milpa y que esta fuera  productiva, todo esto tambien ha ayudado a su familia.
texts.en: José seeks a new loan, as he is in the process of bringing in the corn harvest, for which he needs to pay laborers and costs to transport the harvest to his home.   He says his prior loan experience was excellent, and he was able to obtain fertilizer for his crop, which was very productive and a great help to his family.

loans.use: to pay laborers and transport costs for harvest.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Rayito De Sol Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RAYITO DE SOL” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Germán Busch, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Elvira. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido en alpaca, confección de vestidos, venta de queso y verduras, venta de abarrotes, venta de salchipapas, venta de ropa.

La señora Elvira,  indica que hace mas de cinco años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de su amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de confección de vestidos que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de tela) que comprará las galerías  y posteriormente a la elaboración lo venderá en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio y la capacitación.
texts.en:
The communal association 'Rayito de Sol' [Ray of Sun] started it's first cycle with 'Pro Mujer' as a part of the bigger group Germán Busch. The group is made up of seven members and is led by a board of directors, Elvira is the head of the board. The businesses that the members are involved with are varied and include: weaving from alpaca, dressmaking, selling cheese and vegetables, selling groceries, selling 'salchipapas' (A traditional fast food snack that has thinly sliced pan-fried beef sausages mixed together with French fries and served with different sauces.) and selling clothes.   

Elvira said that she has been working with 'Pro Mujer' for more than five years. She joined the organization when she was invited by a friend. She has a dressmaking business, which she has been doing for years.   

The loan that she is taking out will be used to increase her capital to buy fabrics,which she will buy in the galleries and later will make into dresses to sell at fairs. This work allows her to generate income to support her family. She lives with her husband and three children.  

When she was asked what she likes about 'Pro Mujer' she said she likes the consulting and trainings.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto, necesita fortalecer el negocio, para él la mejor opción es solicitar un préstamo con esta institución, ya que quiere que la ganadería vaya creciendo y se le ha dado la oportunidad de comprar tres terneros, esta será su inversión, de la cual espera en un futuro tener ganancias.
El comenta que ha recibido mejoras desde su último préstamo, ya que pudo invertirlo y manejar el préstamo en sus pagos, ayudando mejor a su familia y sintiéndose más dichoso en su oficio.
texts.en: Rigoberto seeks to build his business and the best option is to seek a loan with this lender; his cattle raising activity is growing and he now has the opportunity to buy three calves.  By making this investment, he hopes to secure future earnings.  He notes that his last credit yielded good benefits as he was able to invest and manage payments, helping his family and feeling more secure in his business.

loans.use: to buy three calves

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, quiere seguir trabajando con préstamos, ya que le dan lo necesario para que el negocio funcione bien,  ella comprara camarones, pescados de varias especies, langostas, conchas, ostras, todo lo mejor en mariscos frescos, para que sus clientes mantengan la preferencia.
Ella ha tenido un efecto positivo en cuanto a la inversión anterior, ya que realizo una buena compra y esto le ha dado mejor disponibilidad de productos para los clientes. Su familia se encuentra bien, apoyándola en todos sus proyectos.
texts.en: María is eager to continue working with credit, as this allows her business to run smoothly.  She plans to buy shrimp, various kinds of fish and lobster, shellfish, oysters and other fresh seafood, to provide a wide variety of items for her clients.  Maria notes that her prior loan had very positive benefits, and allowed her to make good purchases to offer better products for her customers.  Her family is well and supports her in all of her projects.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, various kinds of fish and lobster.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos de 63 años de edad es viuda  y en la actualidad ya todos sus hijos son mayores de edad, tiene su casa propia, la cual está ubicada en  el  Caserío rural Amaru Inca  Valle de los Incas  Distrito de Tambogrande, distrito que pertenece a la provincia de Piura la cual esta ubicada a unas 3 horas aproximadamente de la ciudad de Chiclayo y el Departamento de Lambayeque, la zona en la que vive es  netamente agrícola.

Santos se dedica de manera diaria a la agricultura para lo que cuenta con 2 has de terreno. En una ha sembrado limón y en la otra mango respectivamente los cuales son ofrecidos y vendidos ya sea a sus cliente del mercado local o de sus caseríos aledaños. Adicionalmente también esta empezando su negocio de venta de animales menores como los ovinos, negocio el cual desea hacer crecer y así mejorar su calidad de vida, para lo que solicita un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1500 Nuevos Soles.

Santos destinara el crédito a la compra de alimentos para el engorde de ovinos, y la compra de abonos para su plantación de limón y a la vez realizar mejoras en su domicilio debido a que está construida de material rustico y un poco deteriorada por las constantes lluvias.

Santos y sus hijos son personas trabajadoras, amables y muy respetadas por sus vecinos de la zona en la que viven.
texts.en:
Santos is 63 years old and is a widow. All of her children are adults. She has her own home that is located in the rural community of Amaru Inca, in the Valle de los Incas (Valley of the Incas), in the district of Tambogrande, which is a part of the province of Piura. Piura is located approximately 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo and the department of Lambayeque. The area in which she lives is all agricultural. 

Santos makes a living working day to day as a farmer. She has two plots of land. In one of the plots she has planted lemons and in the other mangoes. She sells the fruit to customers in her local market or in markets in close by rural communities. Additionally she has started a business selling small animals such as sheep. She would like to make this business bigger and by doing so improve her quality of life. It is for this that she has requested a loan in 'Edpyme Alternative' for the amount of 1500 Nuevos Soles. 

Santos will use the loan to buy feed to fatten the sheep, fertilizer for her plantation of lemons and will also make improvements to her home, because it is built of rustic materials and has damage caused by the constant rains.  

Santos and her children are hard workers, kind and very well respected by their neighbors in the area where they live.

loans.use: to buy feed to fatten up the sheep and to buy fertilizer for her plantation of lemons, and also to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Merys María

texts.es: Merys compró materias primas al pormayor y de contado, como huevos, vitina, harina de trigo etc, En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva porque necesita comprar materias primas en mayor volumen, hacer adecuaciones a su local, pintar su refrigerador y continuar brindando un buen servicio a su distinguida clientela. Ella envia el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva:   "Su apoyo es muy importante porque con ello se está ayudando a mejorar las condiciones de vida de muchos colombianos"
texts.en: Merys bought raw materials at wholesale and paid in cash, like eggs, Vitina (a brand of wheat semolina with added vitamins), wheat flour, etc. Currently she is applying for a new loan through Kiva because she needs to buy raw ingredients in a larger volume, make improvements to her location, paint her refrigerator and continue providing good service to her distinguished customers. She would like to send the following message to the lenders on Kiva.org, "Your support is very important because it is helping to improve the standard of living for many Colombians."

loans.use: to buy raw materials in bulk and to make improvements to her location, like painting her refrigerator.

loans.name: Jerida

texts.en:
Jerida is 45 years old. She is married to Kamau; together, they have four children aged 25, 23, 20 and 13 years. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 10 years. She gets a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings from the business.

This is her first loan term. She will use the loan amount to purchase pesticides and to put up a nursery bed for vegetables. She was brought to KADET LTD by a staff member. Her dream is to manage to put up a greenhouse.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and put up a nursery bed for vegetables.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is a 30-year-old business man in Voi. He is married and a father of two school-going children. He owns a photo studio, a business he has been running for the past six years with success.

This is his third business loan from KADET  LTD to finance his business. With the loan, he plans to purchase new digital cameras and new films. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. He dreams of having a successful family.

loans.use: to purchase new digital cameras and new films

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man, age 56, supporting three members of his family. His children are 15 and 17 years old. He does farming in Kapsabet and has been in operation for 12 years. He earns a monthly income of 23,000 KES.

He is now servicing his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds for his farm. The profits will be used to plough back into the farm. He hopes to produce more from the farm and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Helida

texts.en:
Helida is 47 years old, widowed, and the mother of six children between the ages of 10 and 22. Hilda operates a business selling vegetables. She has been operating her business for the last 11 years and earns a monthly income of 6,000 KES. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy vegetables.

Her profits will be used to educate her children. Her dream is to have a big grocery.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Angel  tiene 32 años de edad, él vive en Ica, Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente. En su tiempo libre disfruta escuchar música;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Miguel Angel  es Ceviche Mixto. Miguel Angel estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser Odontólogo; el es padre de un pequeño de 2 añitos al cual adora mucho y es su razón de vivir.	
	
"Miguel Angel se dedica al venta de artículos de limpieza aparatos y equipos domésticos , se dedica a este trabajo 9 horas diarias,. En un día Miguel Angel puede 20 clientes y esto le permite ganar, porque ofrece un buen servicio y productos con calidad. El está muy agradecido con los  prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda brindada el podrá comprar más mercadería y con ello podrá ayudarle a mejorar la variedad de los productos  que ofrece a sus clientes y así seguir luchando para cumplir su gran sueño: “Tener su propio local en el centro de la ciudad."
texts.en:
Miguel Angel is 32 years old. He lives in Ica, Perú which is located in the Sechura desert, about four hours south of Lima, the capital of the country. Ica is known by Peruvians as "La Tierra del Sol" (the land of sun). It is known in Peru for having earthquakes often (one 8.0 in 2007 and one 6.9 in 2011), it's production of grapes, asparagus and olives, and perhaps above all, for being the source of the traditional national drink of Peru, Pisco.

It is in this dry and hot climate that the house and business of the client is located. In his free time he enjoys listening to music. As Peru is known for having some of the most delicious food in the world, one of Miguel's favorite dishes is ceviche. Miguel Angel studied through the fifth year of secondary school, but he would have liked to continue studying to become a dentist. He is the father of two year old, who he adores greatly and who is his reason to live.     

Miguel Angel makes a living selling house cleaning equipment and supplies. He works for 9 hours a day doing this. In one day Miguel Angel can serve as many as 20 customers; this allows him to make a profit because he offers good service and products of high quality. He is very thankful to the lenders on Kiva.org because as a result of their support he is able to buy more merchandise. With this he will be able to improve the variety of products he has to offer to his customers and continue working towards his great dream: "To have his own local for his business in the center of the city."

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Soppante Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Soppanté existe depuis le 28 décembre 2010; il est composé de vingt femmes issues de la fusion de deux hameaux et qui ont longtemps travaillé ensemble en bénéficiant de projets de plusieurs ONG. Leurs activités principales sont le petit commerce et l'élevage.

Madame Collé la responsable est âgée de 25 ans, elle est mariée mère de quatre enfants, elle mène une activité de petit commerce de légumes avec une expérience de plus de 2 ans. Sur la photo elle est debout tout à fait à droite habillée en blanc avec pagne orange et a croisé les bras. 


Elle s'approvisionne au marché central de la ville pour revendre dans son village

Son prêt lui servira à augmenter la quantité et à choisir une bonne qualité des légumes afin d'attirer la clientèle et se faire plus de revenus.

Elle aide son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Soppanté was created on December 28, 2010. It is made up of of twenty women from two hamlets and who have been working together for a long time with help from several NGOs. Their main activities are retail and animal breeding. 

Madame Colle is 25 years old, and is the leader of the group. She is married and has four children. For more than two years, she has worked as a retailer selling vegetables. In the photo, she is standing at the far right, wearing white with an orange skirt, and with her arms crossed. The loan will allow her to increase the quantity and quality of the vegetables, to attract more clients and make more profit. Madame Colle helps her husband in meeting the family's various expenses.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Felisters

texts.en: Felisters, a 42-year-old married mother of three children aged 13, 10 and 3, has been in the business of selling charcoal for six years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. Felisters is requesting a loan of KES. 20,000 to buy more bags of charcoal for resale, and plans to use the profit to boost her business. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Angel Cecilio

texts.es:
Ángel es un hombre de 46 año, tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de seguir con su panadería su historia empezó cuando su familia tuvo una panadería en Quito (capital del Ecuador), le gusto la actividad y desde ahí empecé a realizarlo panes con la ayuda de su familia. 

En la actualidad trabaja solo, realiza la masa y elabora el pan, vende por la mañana y por la tarde, no hay dificultad es muy conocido por el sector, si está casado tiene una libre y su esposa vende comida, almuerzo y desayunos tiene 4 hijos de 21, 19, 13 y 11 años los dos menores están en colegio fiscal y los mayores están comprometidos su sueño es tener una panadería más grande implementar una en el centro y crecer para seguir ampliando mis ventas. Por eso quiere el préstamo para invertir en mi venta de pan como harina, levadura etc.
texts.en: Ángel is a 46 year old man.  He has high aspirations for the continuation of his bakery in the coming years.  His story began in his family’s bakery in Quito, the capital of Ecuador.  He enjoyed this business and, with his family’s help, he began making bread.  Right now, he works alone making the dough and baking the bread.  He sells his baked goods in the morning and in the afternoon, which isn’t difficult as he is well-known in the neighborhood.  He is in a common law marriage and his wife sells lunch and breakfast foods. They have four children, ages 21, 19, 13, and 11.  The two youngest are in school and the older children are engaged. His dream is to expand his business by establishing a larger bakery in the city center in order to continue increasing his sales.  For this reason, he wishes to invest the loan in bread, flour, and yeast.

loans.use: to purchase, flour, eggs, and yeast.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, de 39 años es una valerosa madre soltera. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos: José y Franck a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Yanamarca. Ya tiene 15 años vendiendo productos de primera necesidad como panes, fideos, leche y demás. Es conocida entre sus pobladores quienes llegan a su tienda para poder comprar lo necesario. Al medio día alista sus herramientas para dirigirse a sus terrenos agrícolas, donde siembra papa, cebada, habas y alverja. En esta temporada alquiló algunas parcelas pues no se abasteció en la siembra. Espera con ansias la temporada de cosecha, ya que los comerciantes llegan a sus mismos terrenos para cómpralas ahí mismo. Cuenta que ya tiene propuestas de venta. Cría también toros, vacas y cerdos que comercializa cuando están gorditos y saludables a los carniceros que llegan a la localidad. Ahora quiere incursionar en la venta de bebidas, pues le solicitan mucho. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Virgen María” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Nancy de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos y si el dinero le alcanza comprará productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Nancy is 39 years old and a valiant single mother. She lives with her 2 children, Jose and Franck, for whom she provides care in her own house, located in Yanamarca. For 15 years she has sold products of primary necessity, such as bread, beans, milk, and other items. Nancy is well-known among the residents who come to her store to buy necessities. At mid-day, she gets out her tools and heads for her agricultural fields where she sows potatoes, barley, beans and peas.

In this season, Nancy rents some parcels because her fields don't produce sufficient crops. She waits anxiously for harvest season, when merchants visit her lands to buy her crops on the spot. She says she already has offers to buy. 

Nancy also raises bulls, cows, and pigs and sells them when they are fat and healthy to butchers who visit the region. Now she wishes to begin selling drinks as her customers are requesting them.
