Nancy belongs to the “Virgen Maria” (Virgin Mary) solidarity group and this is her 3rd loan through MFP. She awaits this small loan that will help her reach her objectives. And she promises, once more, to comply with the repayment schedule. In addition, she is grateful to be a part of her association because all the members are responsible people with a sense of solidarity.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and products of primary necessity to supply her store.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert, 50 years old, is married to Margaret and supports four members of his family. He has three children aged 18, 15 and 11 years. Gilbert is a mechanic and also has a business managed by his wife selling maize. He is applying for a loan of  KES.20,000 to buy more bags of maize for resale, and wishes to use the profit from his business to start new projects. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of maize for resale.

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
This is Almira, a 36-year-old resident of Pasay City, Philippines, the mother of three children and wife to Elvin, a driver. Along with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Almira operates a retailing business selling garlic, onions, peanuts, etc. purchased from wholesalers. Customers are attracted to buy due to her low selling prices and the many choices she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, and she earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Almira hopes to expand her store and help her children through all of her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lucia Ramona

texts.es: Lucia Ramona la actividad a la que se dedica es a la venta de mercadería en general lo cual  ella ya tiene años de experiencia y sus cliente la visitan por que la calidad de servicio que le ofrece es muy  bueno y  la variedad de producto, ella ya ha  tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000 y es una excelente clienta y sobre todo ha demostrados ser una persona perseverante y con el sueño de crecer cada día con su negocio. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para comprar  mercadería como pantalones, blusas, camisas, falta, sandalias, y variedad de cosméticos entre otros productos que demandan.
texts.en: Lucia Ramona sells general merchandise.  She already has years of experience and her customers come to her because she provides high-quality service and offers a wide variety of products.  She has already had credit with Fundación León 2000.  She is an excellent customer and, above all, she has she has proved herself to be persevering person.   Her dream is to grow her business each day.  She is requesting the current loan to purchase merchandise such as trousers, blouses, shirts, skirts, sandals, and a variety of cosmetics, as well as other products that are in demand.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as trousers, blouses, shirts, skirts, sandals, and a variety of cosmetics, as well as other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, juice, snacks, candy, cookies, and popsicles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bulbs, bulb holders and adapters.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 49-year-old business lady in Mariakani. She is a married mother of four. She sells coconuts, a business she has been doing for the past seventeen years successfully. 

This marks her third borrowing from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase more coconuts for resale. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. 

She dreams of having a successful life and a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 45 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Rosalina works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. In the future, Rosalina would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase medicines and vitamins.

loans.name: Maria Silbina

texts.es:
María, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para darle mantenimiento al negocio, este préstamo le servirá para comprarse una plancha industrial para hacer pupusas, esto le ayudara para mejorar el negocio y progresar poco a poco en el negocio.
María tuvo una buena experiencia con el préstamo anterior, su negocio se ha mantenido. Este es su segundo financiamiento.
texts.en:
Maria has decided to apply for a new loan in order to maintain her business. It will help her to buy an industrial grill to make pupusas (a Salvadoran snack), which in turn will help her to improve her business. 

Maria had a good experience with her previous loan - it helped her to keep her business running. This is her second loan.

loans.use: To buy an industrial grill.

loans.name: Iris Noemy

texts.es:
Iris,  se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo préstamo,  para invertirlo en la compra cemento, ladrillo, hierro, laminas, esta inversión es para mejorar la vivienda, con ello estará en mejores condiciones con su familia, haciendo las reparaciones debidas.

Ella considera que las condiciones de ella y su familia han cambiado, mejorando y con la esperanza de seguir haciéndolo.  

Este es el segundo prestamo para Iris, el primero lo uso para fortalecer el negocio, el cual ya cancelo, ya que administra una tienda.
texts.en:
Iris has decided to apply for a new loan to invest in the purchase of cement, bricks, iron, and laminate. This investment is to improve her home. By making the needed repairs, she and her family will have better living conditions.

She feels her living conditions and those of her family have changed, improving and with the hope of continuing to improve.

This is the second loan for Iris. She used the first to strengthen her business, since she runs a store.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, iron, and laminate

loans.name: Leonila Aracely

texts.es:
Leonila, de nuevo solicita un segundo préstamo, para comprar un pedido de ropa americana como; camisas, blusas, carteras de esa forma mejorara sus ventas, puesto que tendrá variedad para ofrecerles a sus clientes. 

El préstamo anterior le ayudo porque de sus ganancias logro darle el estudio a su hijo y contribuyo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Leonila is currently requesting a second loan to purchase an order of American clothing such as shirts, blouses, and handbags, and in this way improve her sales by  having a variety of items to offer for sale to her customers.

Her earlier loan helped her because with her earnings she was able to pay for her child's education and contribute to the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, blouses and handbags.

loans.name: Daysi Romelia

texts.es:
Daysi, tiene la necesidad de fortalecer el negocio, para mantener los materiales necesarios para la costura, comprara hilos, telas, botones, con estos nuevos materiales espera mejorar eficiencia, elaborando más rápidamente las prendas de vestir.
Ella considera que con el préstamo anterior, pudo mejorar y que ha sido un gran apoyo para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Daysi needs to strengthen her business.  To have the materials that are necessary for sewing, she will buy thread, fabric, and buttons.  With these new materials she hopes to improve efficiency, making the articles of clothing more quickly.  

She considers that with the previous loan she managed to improve, and that it has been a great help for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy thread, cloth and bottons.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 23 years old. He is married to Lydiah. He sells disk movies and music disks. He has been in the business for the past year. He gets a monthly income of about KES 9,000 from his business.

This is his first loan term in KADET LTD. He will use the loan amount to purchase disks and CDs to sell in his business. His dream is to open another business in a bigger shop and sell wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase more disks and CDs to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 48-year-old single mother with three children, aged 22, 17 and 15 years. She is in the business of selling scrap metals. She started one year ago and earns a monthly income of about KES 40,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to buy scrap metals for resale.  Her profit will help her pay fees for her children and support her family.

loans.use: To purchase scrap metals for resale.

loans.name: Yenis Maritza

texts.es:
Yenis, está interesada en un nuevo préstamo, para utilizarlo en el alquiler de un terreno para utilizarlo para la nueva siembra de maíz y frijol, con este préstamo podrá cubrir el gasto del alquiler e iniciar rápidamente los procesos de siembra.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a Yenis a comprar insumos agrícolas para los cultivos, gracias a Dios tuvo buenos resultados con buenas cosechas.
texts.en:
Yenis is interested in a new loan to use in paying for the rent on a plot of land that she will use to plant corn and beans. With this loan she will be able to cover the cost of the rent and quickly begin the planting processes.

Her previous loan helped Yenis to purchase agricultural supplies for her crops. Thanks to God she had good results with good harvests.

loans.use: to pay the for rent a plot of land to farm.

loans.name: Mabel Antonia

texts.es:
Mabel, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de materiales para hacer mejoras a la vivienda, ella comprara arena, cemento, hierro, estos materiales son para reparar un cuarto, ya que aun no está terminado.

Ella considera que el préstamo anterior fue muy productivo, ya que invirtió en el negocio, dándole mayor variedad de productos y mejorando las ventas.
texts.en:
Mabel is requesting a new loan to buy construction materials like sand, cement and iron rods to make improvements to her home. These materials will be used to repair a bedroom that is still unfinished. 

She believed the previous loan was very productive because she was able to invest it in her business, which provided her with a better variety of products and improved her sales.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and iron rods

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para su negocio, invirtiéndolo en ropa para vender como blusas, faldas, pantalones, esto le ayudara a surtirlo de nuevos estilos y mantener la preferencia de los clientes.
Su condición como comerciante ha mejorado, así lo considera Gerardo,  viviendo ahora mejor que antes junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Gerardo is requesting a new loan for his business to invest in clothing to sell, such as blouses, skirts, and pants.  This will help him stock up on new styles and continue to be his customers' preferred source of clothing.

He considers his circumstances as a salesman as having improved, and he and his family are living better now than before.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, and pants.

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es:
Ana, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, con el propósito de que su negocio mantenga productos de calidad, en esta ocasión  comprara talcos, cremas, lociones, para ofrecer en el negocio, este préstamo le dará mejoras al negocio y para que sus ventas mejoren.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para mejorar la disponibilidad en el negocio, haciéndolo más fuerte y competente, aunque sus ultimos pagos fueron atrasados esto no le permite republicar su prestamo numero dos.
texts.en:
Ana has decided to request a new loan with the aim of maintaining quality products in her business.  This time, she will buy powders, creams, and lotions to sell in her business.  This loan will improve her business and increase her sales.

She believes her previous loan helped her improve the availability of her business, making it stronger and more competent, although her last payments were late.  This is why she is not allowed to republish her second loan.

loans.use: to buy powders, creams, and lotions.

loans.name: Maria Maura

texts.es:
Doña Maria tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos entre 24 a 20 años de edad, los cuales ya son independientes, vive en al aldea La Jutosa, Choloma, Cortes.
La actividad económica a que se dedica Doña Maria es una pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios (arroz, frijoles, pan, churros, aguacates y cebolla). Inicio su negocio hace 4 años con un préstamo son odef. Posteriormente con las ganancias logro aumentar su inventario y cuenta con una clientela fija, lo que le permite un aumento en sus ventas y además la demanda de oferta de mas productos, atendiendo a sus clientes todo el día.
Ha obtenido ya varios préstamos con ODEF, los cuales le han seguido ayudando a mantener activo su negocio. Actualmente ha solicitado su préstamo numero ocho de 5,000 lempiras para invertir en la compra de granos básicos productos. (Harina, arroz, manteca, frijoles. Azúcar, condimentos, sal etc.).
Su sueño es aumentar las ventas y con las ganancias crecer económicamente y lograr un negocio estable.
texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old and is a single mother. She has four children between 20 and 24 years of age who are all independent. She lives in the village of La Jutosa, Choloma, Cortes. 

Maria makes a living with her corner store business where she sells food items (rice, beans, bread, churros, avocados, and onions). She began the business four years ago with a loan from ODEF. Later, with the profits she was able increase her inventory. She has a stable customer base which allows her to increase her sales. There is also a demand for more products. She attends to her customers all day. 

She has already received many loans from ODEF which have continued to help her keep her business active. Currently she is requesting her eighth loan for 5,000 lempiras to invest in purchasing basic food products (flour, rice, lard, beans, sugar, condiments, salt, etc.).

Her dream is to increase her sales and with the profits, grow financially and maintain a stable business.

loans.use: to buy basic goods (flour, rice, lard, beans, sugar, condiments, salt, etc.).

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana de 52 años de edad se dedica al comercio de mercancía variada mediante guías especializadas de productos; ella en su condición de mujer separada;  generó con su negocio ingresos para el bue desempeño de su hogar, conformado por sus tres hijos,  hoy en las edades de 22 a 33 años. Gradualmente ha logrado agregar diversos productos como artículos de aseo personal, perfumes, cremas, y vestuario en general. Su meta mas adelante es tener un punto comercial tipo almacén, donde venda variedades de mercancías, con las cuales sostenga una clientela al detalle y de contado. Su mayor desafío es su capital de trabajo, el cual resulta insuficiente para responder a su creciente clientela y esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará mercancías que vienen con descuentos en sus catálogos, y sobre la cual ya ha realizado la preventa. Así su inversión seria exitosa, porque sus clientes rentables están atentos a la llegada de vestidos, artículos para el hogar, que están con un buen precio en las revistas y que ellos obtendrían aun crédito muy fácil de pagar.
texts.en: Ana is 52 and sells various merchandise through specialized product guides.  She is separated.  Her business has generated income so her home, which is made up of her three children, can operate well.  Her children are between 22- and 33-years-old.  She has gradually succeeded in adding different products like toiletries, perfumes, creams, and clothing in general.  Her goal for the future is to have a place to sell her products like a department store, where she can sell various merchandise, with which she will sustain her retail clientele.  Her biggest challenge is working capital, which is insufficient to respond to her increasing clientele.  This is her reason for requesting a loan from Kiva.  This is her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she will use it to buy merchandise that is discounted in her catalogs.  She has already made the pre-sale of these items, so her investment will be successful because her customers are attentive to the arrival of dresses and items for the home that are sold at a good price in magazines, and they would obtain credit very easily to pay for them.

loans.use: to buy dresses and items for the home at a discount.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the engine of her minibus.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily, 22 years old, is from Kisumu City, along the the shore of Lake Victoria. She is married to Kennedy and they have two children, 6 and 7 years old.

For the last 5 years, Emily has operated a grocery, selling fruits and vegetables. She makes a monthly income of KES 6,000. Emily is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy oranges, mangoes, tomatoes, kale and bananas. Emily will channel her business to increasing her stock. Her dream is to have a big grocery.

loans.use: To buy mangoes, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 33-year-old married woman blessed with five children aged between 3 and 12 years old.  She buys and sells ready-made school uniforms for resale at the Boya trading centre. She has operated her business for seven years, earning a monthly income of KES 8,000.

Rose wishes to use her first term loan of KES 19,500 from KADET LTD to purchase school uniforms for resale. She will use any profits to reinvest in the business and to repay the loan. Rose's dream is to improve in business and to raise her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase school uniforms for resale

loans.name: Beda

texts.en: Beda is 51 years old and supports her two children, aged 16 and 12. She has been a dairy farmer for the past 10 years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. For her first loan, Beda has requested KES 20,000 to buy a milk cow. Profit from her business would help Beda repay her loan. Her dream is to one day become a large scale dairy farmer.

loans.use: To buy another milk cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and eggs.

loans.name: Heou

texts.en:
Mrs. Heou has been operating a fish selling business in a local market in the Baray district. She always gets up in the early morning to buy fresh fish in bulk from her suppliers, and then she sells them at retail in the marketplace. Heou generates an income of approximately $2 per day to meet her daily needs. Heou is married and has 2 children.

Heou will use her first loan from HKL and Kiva to buy bean seeds and 10 bags of fertilizer for both her bean crops and dry season rice crops. In the future, Heou aims to improve her family-owned businesses, especially rice husbandry.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en:
Teymur is 25 years old and single. He sells fruits such as pears, oranges, apples, pomegranates and bananas. Teymur has 4 years of experience in this field and has gained the necessary skills and knowledge required for his business. 

Fruits are very popular among Azerbaijan people and in high demand during the year. People like to eat fresh fruit and it is one of the main desserts for guests. Teymur's shop is located in the central bazaar and people always pass his shop and come to buy some fresh fruits. His father helps him to sell the fruits.  Teymur's monthly income from his business is 300 AZN. 

Teymur wants to expand his business. The amount of products he sells is not enough to cover the high demand. He would like to purchase more fruits and vegetables, increase his turnover and improve his family's life. He has therefore applied for a loan of 1,200 AZN. Teymur has a good client history and this will be his second loan.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables and increase turnover

loans.name: Oneyda María

texts.es:
La joven Oneyda María tiene su propia vivienda en el municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón y actualmente está pasando dificultades ya que ha comenzado a tener malas condiciones en dicha vivienda por lo que tuvo la oportunidad a través de sus amistades de darse cuenta que Ceprodel apoyaba para este tipo de actividades.

Se presentó por primera vez para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como cemento, arena, y zinc. Está consciente que Ceprodel apoya a este tipo de personas y espera que dicho crédito sea otorgado para así iniciar su obra de mejora de su vivienda que tanto lo requiere para beneficio propio y de la familia.
texts.en:
Young Oneyda María lives in her own house in the town of Santa Rosa del Peñon. She is currently in need of help as the conditions of her house have begun to worsen, and through her friend she had the chance to come to know that Ceprodel supported this kind of needs.

She has come to Ceprodel for the first time to ask for a loan she will use to buy construction materials such as cement, sand and zinc. She is aware of the fact that Ceprodel supports people like her, and she hopes this loan will be granted in order to start the improvement works on her house, something she greatly needs for her family’s benefit as well as her own.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and zinc.

loans.name: Dinorah Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dinorah, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, ya que ha recibido buena atención, y tiene la necesidad de invertir en el negocio, ella comprara plátanos, yuca, aceite, para el negocio.
Ella considera que ha mejorado su condición, que estos préstamos le han permitido ir superándose y obtener mejores ingresos por sus ventas.
texts.en:
Dinorah decided to apply for a new loan, which was favorably granted. She needs to invest in her business and will buy plantains, cassava and oil for her food production.

She believes that her condition has improved and that these loans enabled her to be successful and earn a higher income from her sales.

loans.use: to buy plantains, cassava and oil for her food production.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi, 37 years old, is a single mother of two children aged 20 and 17. She has operated a green grocery store for two years. She earns a monthly income of KES 34,500 from her business.

This is Naomi's first loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase cabbages and potatoes to sell. Naomi was introduced to KADET LTD by a client. Her dream is to manage to put up rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of cabbages and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Hajjat

texts.en:
Hajjat is 33 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala north region of Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, with 4 of them currently in school. For the past 6 years, Hajjat has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Hajjat has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale, and will help Hajjat to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Hajjat hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a wholesale shop. 

Hajjat is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), which primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hajjat who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale,

loans.name: Raquilda

texts.es:
Raquilda, de 48 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Jorge con quien tuvo 5 hijos de los cuales solo vive con uno de ellos: Miguel a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Daniel Hernández. Su principal actividad durante la semana es la compra y venta de ovejas. Consiste en recopilar ovejas de los ganaderos, los que después vende a más precio en la feria ganadera que existe en las diferentes localidades de su ciudad. Viaja mucho, por eso es muy conocida en su zona. Ya los fines de semana, junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de leña. Compran árboles y ellos mismo cortan la leña para comercializarlos a la ciudad de Huancayo, donde tienen clientes fijos. Cuenta que no tiene un ingreso fijo, ya que su capital varia de acuerdo al grosor de los árboles, depende de ellos los resultados. Paralelo a ese trabajo su esposo realiza el oficio de albañil, arreglando diferentes casas y construyendo otras. Todo depende del contrato que realice. Ahora desea incrementar su capital de trabajo para seguir produciendo más. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Raquilda de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más árboles para producir más leña.
texts.en:
Raquilda, who is 48 years old, is a hard-working woman. She lives with Jorge, with whom she had five children, of whom only one lives with them: Miguel, who takes care of them in their own house, located in the district of Daniel Hernández. Her main activity during the week is the purchase and sale of sheep. Her business consists of collecting sheep from the stock farmers, and later she sells them for a higher price at the livestock markets which exist in different locations in her city. She travels a lot, and so she is very well known in her area. On weekends, she and her husband sell firewood. They buy trees and they themselves cut the firewood to market it in the city of Huancayo, where they have regular customers. She tells us that she does not have a secure income, since her capital varies according to the size of the trees; her results depend on this. Alongside this work, her husband works as a mason, repairing various houses and building others. Everything depends on the contracts he makes. Now she wants to increase her working capital to continue producing more. This is her seventh loan with MFP, where she hopes for a small loan so that she can complete her objectives. On the other hand, she promises once more to make her payments. In addition, she is thankful to be part of her association (communal bank) because all its members are responsible and united.

Raquilda, on receiving her loan, will invest the money she has requested in the purchase of more trees to produce more firewood.

loans.use: to buy more trees for firewood

loans.name: Nasimi

texts.en:
Nasimi, 33 years old, is married and has two children. He has 3 years of experience in selling men's clothing. His wife actively helps him choose appropriate merchandise because she has good taste.

Nasimi chose this business because it is very profitable and he has gained permanent clients over the years. He is friendly, polite and always gives a discount. Nasimi says the secret of his success is his shop's location, on the central bazaar. Nasimi's monthly income is 230 AZN, which is not enough to cover his family's needs. He has applied for a loan of 800 AZN to expand his business. He will use this loan to purchase new merchandise and diversify. He has good credit history and this will be his second loan.

loans.use: to purchase more men's clothing and diversify

loans.name: Janneh

texts.en:
Janneh, 30 years old, lives in Jacob Town. She is married and has four children aged between 3 and 10 years old. They are all in school, except the younger one, and they all live at home.

For the past twelve years, Janneh has been selling candy, biscuits and pepper in her community. She started this business from her savings and she enjoys the independence. Janneh says that buying is sometimes slow. She is requesting a loan a to purchase more candy, biscuits and pepper for her business. Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more candy, biscuits and pepper for her business

loans.name: El Rancho Progreso Group

texts.es:
La señora Sebastiana es casada, tiene 34 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educacion primaria, tiene 4 hijos los cuales estudian, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros, iniciando este negocio con poco capital y hasta el momento lleva 7 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo trabajo.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería consistente en ropa, Suéteres, playeras, blusas, sudaderos, y entre otros. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio con mas capital. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la artesanía y al comercio.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is married and is 34 years old. She completed six years of primary school and has four children who are studying. She makes a living in the business of selling women's and men's clothing. She started this business with a little bit of capital and as of now, has seven years of experience. She also has the support of her husband who makes a living in the same line of work. 

She is organizing a group to be able to request a loan which she will use to buy merchandise consisting of clothing like sweaters, t-shirts, blouses, and sweat shirts among other things. In the future she hopes to have a business with more capital. The other members make their livings in handicrafts and sales.

loans.use: to buy clothing like sweaters, t-shirts, blouses, and sweat shirts among other things.

loans.name: Moises Adali

texts.es:
Moisés, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en medicamentos para el negocio, como la compra de vitaminas, productos medicinales, sueros, entre otros más que existen y que él necesita para mejorar su inventario.
Él considera que estos préstamos le han permitido mejorar en el negocio, que su inventario mantenga productos para todo tipo de enfermedad, además esto le ha ayudado tambien a mejorar la condición de su familia.
texts.en:
Moisés applies for a new loan to invest in medicine for his business. He will buy vitamins, sera and other available medical products which he needs to complete his inventory.

He believes that these loans enabled him to bolster his business, keep products for all kinds of diseases in inventory, and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, sera and medical products.

loans.name: Gaby

texts.es: Gaby, de 19 años, es una joven madre, quien desea un buen bienestar para su querida hija Magdiel de 01 año, a quien brinda mucho amor. Gaby, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos; ella ofrece sus catálogos a sus amigas y vecinas quienes mayormente hacen pedidos. Hace 01 año empezó a realizar esta actividad, pero desde que tuvo a su hija tuvo que esforzarse por seguir adelante. Sin embargo considera difícil el tener que caminar durante todo el día junto a su pequeña hija; pero aun así lo hace por obtener buenas ganancias. Asimismo, labora haciendo recargas a celulares en la cual le va muy bien. Para más adelante lo que prioriza es en comprar productos de cosméticos para luego vender a las personas que le piden. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP,  está dispuesta a pagar de forma puntual ya que mas adelante pueda acceder a otro préstamo. En su banco comunal es una  socia muy colaboradora. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, realizará sus compras de cosméticos.
texts.en:
Gaby, 19, is a young mother who wishes a healthy wellbeing for her dear one-year-old daughter Magdiel, on whom she dotes. Gaby earns a living selling cosmetics. She offers her catalogs to her friends and neighbors, most of whom place orders. She began this business a year ago, but since having her daughter she has had to push herself to get ahead. However she finds it difficult to have to walk around all day with her little girl, but even so she does it in order to make a good income. In addition she works selling cell phone minutes, which is going very well for her. The priority now is buying cosmetics products to sell to those who ask for them. 

This will be her first loan with MFP and she is prepared to pay on time so that she may have access to another loan in the future. In her communal bank she is very supportive of the other members. With the 1,000 Peruvian soles she will make purchases of cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala north region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 4 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Teopista has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which sells chicken. 

To help expand her business, Teopista has requested a loan of 1,700,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more poultry feed, and will help Teopista to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Teopista hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Teopista is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), which primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Teopista who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more poultry feed

loans.name: Maria Elvira

texts.es:
Doña Maria Elvira tiene 45 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos de 25, 22,15 y 9 años de edad,de los cuales 2 de ellos estudian, vive con su familia en la Colonia 9 de mayo, Cofradía, Cortes.
Doña Maria tiene seis años de tener este negocio de elaboración de tortillas de maíz. En su comunidad tiene establecido sus clientes. Ella trabaja muy duro desde las  8.30 de la mañana hasta las 7.00 pm. Este negocio es rentable ya que de allí ha podido aportar más ingresos para la ayuda de su hogar y logrado sacar sus hijos menores adelante.
Doña Maria ha solicitado varios préstamos con ODEF, ahora solicita su quinto préstamo de 10,000 lempiras  para poder invertir en la compra de maíz para la elaboración de tortillas.
Su meta es llegar hacer una microempresaria con mayor rentabilidad y tener una economía estable para seguir ayudando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Elvira is 45 years old, married, and has four children who are 25, 22, 15 and 9 years old. Two of them are studying. She lives with her family in the 9 de Mayo neighborhood of Cofradía, Cortes. 

Maria has had her business making tortillas for six years. She has established a customer base in her community. She works very hard from 8:30 in the morning to 7:00 PM. This is a profitable business as she has been able to contribute more income to help her family and has been able to get her younger children ahead. 

Maria has requested several loans from ODEF. Now she is requesting her fifth loan for 10,000 lempiras to be able to invest in the purchase of corn for making tortillas.

Her goal is to establish a more profitable small business and have a stable income to continue helping her children.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Genaro Deciderio

texts.es: El señor Genaro , es habitante del municipio de la Concepcion , junto a su familia , ellos son de origen Humilde , durante muchos años se han dedicado a la agricultura , la mayor afectacion que se le presenta son los desastres naturales , ya que de tanta lluvia ,casi todas las flores de café se cayeron y la producción fue muy baja , lo que él no cuenta en estos momentos con los recursos necesarios para sacar adelante este año la produccióm , el necesita  fertilizantes e insumos necesarios  para la compra de los suministros .
texts.en: Genaro lives in the municipality of La Concepcion with his family.  His family is of modest origins, and over many years they have been farmers.  The main challenge that he has faced has been the natural disasters, because with so much rain, almost all of the coffee flowers fell off and the production was very low.  At this time, he lacks the resources he needs to get started with this year's production.  He needs fertilizers and agricultural supplies.  This loan will be used to purchase supplies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and agricultural supplies

loans.name: Bibizilol

texts.ru: Бибизилол более восьми лет занимается выращиванием овощей и бахчевых культур. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем. Ее муж работает в ферме. Она берет кредит для закупа семян картошки, арбуза и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: For more than eight years Bibizilol has grown vegetables and melons.  She is 39 years old and married.   Her husband works on their farm.  She is taking out a loan to buy potato and watermelon seed and mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seed

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yessica, de 26 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo, Carlos, con quien se casó hace poco y juntos tienen un hijo, Kener de 10 años de edad, al que cuidan en su casa propia ubicada en Pampa blanca. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer diferente, su trabajo consiste en el trasporte público, manejando un motocarro desde su anexo a la ciudad de Pampas, donde ella traslada a los pobladores del lugar. Según cuenta es muy admirada, pues es una de las pocas mujeres que desarrolla esta actividad. Además distribuye su tiempo con los trabajos eventuales que desarrolla en la gobernación de su localidad, como limpieza de jardines y veredas. Gusta de estar ocupada, por ello constantemente ayuda a su cuñada con el ordeño de sus vacas ahí puede obtener un poco de leche fresca para alimentar a su hijo, a quien quiere mucho. Por su parte su esposo trabaja como albañil en una empresa constructora de casa, donde recibe un sueldo mensual. Ahora su mayor sueño es vivir en Huancayo, una de las ciudades más grandes del país. Ya esta dando el primer paso para lograr sus sueños. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Yessica de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en completar sus ahorros para comprar un terreno propio en la ciudad de Huancayo.
texts.en:
Yessica, 26, is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband, Carlos. They are recently married and have a 10-year-old son together, Kener, who they look after in their own house in the area of Pampa Blanca. Yessica describes herself as an individual and works in private transport, driving an auto-rickshaw from her neighbourhood to the city of Pampas, where she gives lifts to the people that live there. She says that she is very admired because she's one of the few women who do this work. She also spends her time carrying out various jobs for the local government, like cleaning up the gardens and pavements. She likes to keep busy, so she always helps her sister-in-law in looking after her cows, which means she can get a little bit of fresh milk for her son, which he loves.

For his part, her husband works as a bricklayer for a housebuilding company, which gives him a monthly wage. Now their biggest dream is to live in Huancayo, one of the largest cities in the country. They are already taking the first step to achieve this dream. This is Yessica's second credit with MFP; she is hoping for a small loan to help them achieve their goals, and she promises once again to keep up with her repayments. She is happy to be part of the association because all the members are responsible and supportive people. When she receives her loan, Yessica will put the money together with their savings to buy a plot of land in Huancayo.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 48 años es una mujer sabia. Hace 10 años se separó de su esposo. Desde entonces tuvo que cuidar de sus 4 hijos sola, actualmente vive con Jessica y Edith a los que cuida en una casa alquilada en el cerrito de la Libertad, Huancayo. Es conocida en su barrio, ya que durante 12 años deleitó a sus vecinos del rico caldo de gallina y cordero, que solo ella sabe preparar. En un espacio de su casa acondicionó un pequeño restaurante que solo se abre durante las noches, le agrada mucho su trabajo, pues asume su éxito al apoyo d sus hijos quienes son incondicionales para ella. La mayor de sus hijas estudia en la universidad, le enseñó a depender de si misma y salir adelante, “trabaja y apoya en casa”, afirma con orgullo. Por su parte su esposo le manda un pensión mensual que ayuda en algo a los gastos del hogar, pero como ella dice, “es muy poco”. No se desanima, con coraje y el carisma que la caracteriza sabe que logrará sus objetivos, pues quiere ver a sus hijos desarrollados. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “santa teresa” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. María de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad y gaseosa para su restaurante.
texts.en:
María who is 48 years old is a wise woman. Ten years ago she separated from her husband. Since then she has taken care of her 4 children alone. Currently she lives with Jessica and Edith caring for them in a rented house on the hill of Libertad, Huancayo. She is known in her neighborhood because for 12 years she has delighted her neighbors with the delicious chicken and lamb soup that only she knows how to make.

She has fitted out a space at home for a little restaurant that only opens during the evenings. She likes her work a lot because she counts on its success to support her children who are unconditionally for her.

The oldest of her children is studying at university, learning to depend on herself to get ahead, “working and helping at home’, she says with pride. Her husband sends monthly alimony that helps with some of the household expenses, but as she says, “it is very little.” 

She is not discouraged, with the bravery and charisma that she is known for she achieves her goals, wanting to see her children grow up. 

She belongs to the solidarity group Santa Teresa and this is the 7th loan though MFP, where she hopes for a small loan so that she can fulfill her goals. And she promises once again to make her payments on time. Also, she likes being a part of her association because all of the members are trustworthy and united. María upon receiving your support will invest the requested money in the purchase of staple products and soft drinks for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy staples and cases of soft drinks

loans.name: Rafiq

texts.en:
Rafiq is 56 years old.  He is married and has three sons.  

He is a market vendor and sells wheat and flour in his wholesale shop.  He has been in business for 13 years. During this time, he has gained skills, experience as well as wide range of permanent customers.  He sells items with attractive prices and high quality.  His monthly income is 300 AZN.  Rafiq says the location of his shop has brought him success and made his business profitable.

Rafiq has applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN in order to expand his business and purchase more merchandise.  He requires the loan because demand for wholesale products is high and sometimes Rafiq cannot afford all his customers’ orders.  This will be his second loan and Rafiq has good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more wholesale merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Husen

texts.ru: Хусен трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Он женат и любящий отец троих детей. Хусен занимается откормом и реализацией крупного рогатого скота. Он откармливает их в течении 15- 25 дней, а затем продает на рынке. Кроме этого он работает в колхозе и имеет 2,5 гектар арендованную землю. Он там выращивает кукуруза и пшеницу. В бизнесе помогает жена. Хусен хотел бы получить займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Husen is a hardworking and conscientious man.  He is married and the loving father of three children.  Husen is engaged in fattening cattle for resale.  He fattens them over the course of 15 - 25 days before selling them at the market.  Besides this, he works on a collective farm and rents 2.5 ha of land where he grows corn and wheat.   His wife helps him with in his business.  

Husen would like to get a loan for 5000 Somoni to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Rafael Arles

texts.es:
Rafael  tiene 23 años de edad, él vive en Ica, Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú nacional, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente. En su tiempo libre disfruta pasear con su pequeño en el auto sobre todo para distraerse de los problemas;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Rafael  le encanta mucho el Ají de Gallina. 
	
"Rafael se dedica al trabajo como chofer de taxi,  trabaja 15 horas diarias y puede atender alrededor de 70  clientes el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece un buen servicio y sobre todo respeto a los clientes.

Actualmente agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda brindada el podrá realizar un mantenimiento a su vehículo, lo que permitirá tener un vehículo en buen estado para brindar un servicio con seguridad, asimismo  le ayudara a tener mayores ingresos y así seguir luchando para cumplir su gran sueño: Tener una flota de autos y formar su empresa de taxis."
texts.en:
Rafael is 23 and lives in Ica, Peru. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert, around four hours south of Lima, the capital, and is described by Peruvians as the Land of Sun. It is known for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.0 in 2007 and a 6.9 in 2011), its production of grapes, asparagus and olives and, perhaps above all, for being the origin of the traditional Peruvian national drink, pisco. In this hot, arid climate lives Rafael and his customers. In his free time he likes to go out driving with his son to distract himself from his problems. It is well known that Peru is famous for having the most delicious food in the world and one of the dishes that Rafael loves is 'aji de gallina' (chilli chicken).

Rafael is a taxi driver and works 15 hours a day providing transport for around 70 customers. He thinks that he does well in his job because he offers a good service and because he respects his customers. He is grateful to Kiva's lenders because, with the help offered, he will be able to carry out maintenance on his vehicle to keep it in a good state, which will mean he can provide a safe service as well as earning a greater income and progress in his biggest dream of owning a fleet of cars and starting a taxi business.

loans.use: Para realizar mantenimiento a su vehiculo

loans.name: Celia María

texts.es:
La Señorita. Celia es socia del banco comunal Gualaceñitas,  vive en el Cantón de Gualaceo que es un pueblo próspero, asentado en uno de los más bellos valles de la provincia y del país, espléndidos paisajes y agradable clima, por lo que constituye uno de los centros turísticos de primer orden. Sus habitantes cultivan verduras, legumbres, maíz, caña de azúcar, frutas, etc. También se dedican a crear preciosas artesanías. El centro tradicional, aunque pequeño, conserva aún casas de estilo colonial con los típicos portales y segundos pisos sobre pilares, amplios balcones sobre todo, las de la calle Cuenca frente al parque Central.
 
La Señorita Celia tiene 37 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de familiares.
 
Ella una tienda de comestibles, actividad que le desempeña hace 3 años y labora de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 2 años y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su negocio.
 
Su meta es estudiar belleza.
texts.en:
Celia is a member of the "Gualaceñitas" communal bank. She lives in Gualaceo canton, which is a prosperous town located in one of the most beautiful valleys in the province and country. With splendid scenery and pleasant climate, it is a tourist center of the highest order. 

Its inhabitants grow vegetables, legumes, corn, sugar cane, fruit, etc. They also create beautiful crafts. The traditional center, although small, still retains colonial-style homes, with typical doorways, second floors on columns, and spacious balconies, especially those on Cuenca Street across from Central Park.

Celia is 37, single. and lives with her parents, with whom she shares the household expenses. They don't have their own house, so they live in the home of family members. She has a grocery store, a business she has run for three years. She works from Sunday to Sunday, from 6:00 in the morning to 10:00 at night.  

She has been in the communal bank for two years, and she is going to use her loan to buy food products for her business. Her goal is to study to be a beautician.

loans.use: To buy food products.

loans.name: Banco Comunal El Milagro Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal  está  conformado por 11 emprendedoras que han salido adelante juntas, estas emprendedoras no es la primeras vez que está solicitando financiamiento ya que anteriormente se le brindo para aumentar su inversión, ellas nos expresa que gracias al crédito que se le brindo han aumento sus clientela ya que tiene suficiente productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes. Daniela Lisseth tiene 28 años de edad, su actividad a la que se dedica  es la venta de  de ropa usada y además vende enchiladas esta actividad la realiza de forma ambulante, con el crédito desea comprar pantalones, camisas, faldas, shorts, camisolas y trajes entre otros productos
texts.en:
The communal bank is made up of eleven entrepreneurs that have gotten ahead together. This is not the first time these entrepreneurs have requested a loan. The previous loan helped them increase their investment. They tell us that thank to the loan they received they have increased their customer bases as they now have sufficient products to offer to their customers. 

Daniela Lisseth is 28 years old. She makes her living in the business of used clothing sales in addition to selling enchiladas. She does her business as a street vendor. She wants to buy pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, camisoles and suits, among other products, with this loan.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, camisoles and suits, among other products.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío, de 21 años, vive en la comunidad de Huari junto a sus padres y 3 hermanos a los que apoya, y juntos habitan en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de El Tambo. Su frágil apariencia, es solo antónimo de su fortaleza y coraje. Ella estudia Radiología en una universidad reconocida. Para poder costear los gastos comenzó el negocio de compra y venta de ganados, ya que sus padres le enseñaron desde muy pequeña a vivir de la agricultura. Su mayor inspiración es su papá, pues estudió ingeniería de minas y ahora trabaja en una mina, donde llega cada 2 semanas a verlos. “Quiero ser como él”, afirma. En la localidad de Huari, su mamá tiene vacas, ovejas y siembra papa, ahí recolecta las ovejas que compró a los ganaderos, los alimenta y engorda, para luego venderlos a un mayor precio en las diversas ferias que se realizan cada semana en Huancayo. Ahora desea ahorrar y poder abrir un restaurante por donde vive ya que no existe ninguno. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Santa teresa” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Rocío de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más ganado para su negocio.
texts.en: 21 year old Rocío lives in the community of Huari along with her parents and three siblings who she supports. They live together in their own home, located in the city of El Tambo. Although she looks fragile, this belies her strength and courage. She studies radiology in a well known university. To be able to afford the fees, she started a business buying and selling cattle as her parents had taught her how to make a living from farming since she was very little. Her father is her main inspiration - he studied mining engineering and now works in a mine and comes to see them every two weeks. "I want to be like him" she states. At home in Huari, her mother has cows and sheep and grows potatoes. She pens the sheep that she buys from the shepherds there, feeds them and fattens them up to sell them later on for a better price at the different markets that are held each week in Huancayo. Now she wants to save some money and open a restaurant where she lives as there aren't any at the moment. She belongs to the loan group "Santa Teresa" and this is her first loan from MFP, and she is waiting for a small loan so that she can meet her goals. She also promises to make her repayments. She is grateful to be part of the community bank because all the members are responsible and united. When she receives her loan, Rocío will use it to buy more cattle for her business.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: El señor Juan , es habitante del Municipio de la Concepcion , junto a sus hijos , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Juan desde hace varios años se dedica al a la agricultura , gracias a los prestamo que le otorga afodenic atraves de loa fondo Kiva , a logrado darle um mejor mantenimiento a toda su plancion , teniendo como resultados mejores ventas y calidad del produccto , los planes hacia su humilde finca es poder sembrar un cuanto de manzana de citricos especialmente limones ya que este es de mucho consumo y su precio se mantiene , por ahora necesita el financimineto para comprar fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para seguirle dando el mantenimiento adecuado a la planatacion .
texts.en: Juan lives in the municipality of Concepcion along with his children. His plan for the future is to improve their living conditions. Juan has been a farmer for some years. Thanks to the loan that has been offered to him by AFODENIC by way of Kiva, he has been able to better maintain his land and as a result has had better sales and higher quality produce. His plan for his humble farm is to plant an area with citrus fruit, especially lemons, as these are consumed a lot and their price is stable. For now, he needs this loan to buy fertilizers and supplies necessary to keep his land in good condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es: El señor Humberto, es habitante del municpio de la Concepcion, el esta muy contento por el apoyo que le brinda Kiva durante varios ciclos en cuanto a la agricultura ya que gracias a ese financimineto logro establecerlo muy bien , pero ahora necesita un prestamo para realizar el muro frontal de su humilde vivienda ya que es de mucha necesidad para èl , por que en tiempos de lluvia pasa una gran corriente y se pasa llevando arboles , todo lo ques basura y quedan mucho residuos de todos eso enfrente de la humilde vivienda .
texts.en: Humberto is a resident of the Concepcion municipality. He is very happy about the support that Kiva has given him over several agricultural loan cycles. Thanks to these loans he was able to establish himself very well. But now he needs a loan to build a wall in front of his humble home. This is a big necessity of his because during the rainy season a lot of water goes by taking trees and trash with it. It leaves behind a lot of residue in front of his humble home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma, de 36 años es una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de Gregorio, su esposo desde hace 8 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos menores a los que cuidan en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la localidad de Acraquia. Se siente muy feliz, ya que está a punto de tener una casa propia donde vivir. La actividad que desarrolla es múltiple. Cuenta que durante las mañanas trabaja en una casa donde cocina y limpia, ya por las tardes en la construcción de una nueva universidad, donde la paga el estado un sueldo mensual por sus servicios de limpieza. Pero la actividad que nunca deja de desarrollar es la agricultura. Siembra maíz, cebada y papa en sus terrenos agrícolas que son propios. En cada cosecha y después de mucho cuidado, los comercializa al mercado mayorista de su localidad, donde aprovecha para vender los animales que cuida, entre vacas, cerdos, ovejas y gallinas. Le gustaría dedicar todo su tiempo a esto, pero como ella dice “son inversiones a largo plazo”. Por ello tiene que generar ingresos que le permita solventar los gastos de alimentación y estudios para sus hijos. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Irma de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la construcción de su nueva casa, que es propia. Comprará ventanas, puertas y demás accesorios.
texts.en: 36 year old Irma is a cheerful woman. She lives with Gregorio, her husband of 8 years. Together they have 3 small children who they care for in a rented house in the Acraquia area. She feels very happy as she is on the point of owning her own house to live in. She makes a living in multiple ways. During the mornings, she works in a house where she cooks and cleans, and, in the afternoons, she works at a new university that is being built. The state pays her a monthly wage for cleaning services here. But the activity that she never fails to develop is farming. She grows corn, barley, and potatoes on her own land. At each harvest, and after much care, she sells her crops at the main market and also takes advantage of the opportunity to sell the animals that she raises, which include cows, sheep, and chickens. She would like to spend all her time farming but, as she says, "this is a long-term investment."  So, she has to generate income to cover the costs of feeding and educating her children. This is her second loan from MFP, and she is waiting for a small loan so she can meet her goals. She promises to make her repayments. She is grateful to be part of the community bank because all the members are responsible and united people. On receiving her loan, Irma will use it for building her new house, which she will own. She will buy windows, doors, and other items.

loans.use: to buy windows and doors.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es: Nélida, de 35 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo con quien se casó desde hace 3 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos a los que cría en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Pampa blanca. Su principal fuente de ingreso es la venta de comida a las enfermeras de su anexo. Quienes le pagan por la alimentación que reciben durante el día. Además abrió una tienda de comestibles hace 3 años, donde vende productos de primera necesidad a los pobladores de su zona. Por su parte su esposo, trabaja como chofer llevando carga en el camión de sus padres a todo el país, “a veces se ausenta varios días”, comenta. Por ello, ella tiene que administrar sus sembríos de papa en terrenos heredados, donde supervisa el crecimiento y ya en la cosecha lo comercializa a la capital del país, donde aprovecha el trabajo de su esposo para trasladarlos y obtener mejores ganancias. Ahora piensa trasladar sus cosas a un cuarto seguro, pues el sismo que ocurrió hace poco rajó la pared de casa, la que derrumbará para construir una más resistente. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Nelida de recibir su apoyo; podrá implementar dos cuartos con buen material a fuera de su casa.
texts.en: Nélida, who is 35 years old, is a hard-working woman. She lives with her husband, to whom she has been married for 3 years. They have 3 children whom they are raising in their own home, located in Pampa Blanca. Her principal source of income is the sale of food to the nurses in their annex, who pay her for the food they receive during the day. In addition, she opened a grocery store 3 years ago, where she sells basic products to the residents of her zone. On his part, her husband works as a driver, carrying cargo in his parents' truck all over the country. "Sometimes he is absent for a few days," she comments. For that reason, she has to manage their plantings of potatoes on inherited land, where she supervises the growing and then at harvest time she sells them in the capital of the country, where she takes advantage of her husband's work to transport them and obtain better earnings. Now she is thinking of moving her things to a secure room, since the earthquake that occurred a little while ago split the wall of the house, which she will pull down to build a more resistant one. This is her second loan from MFP, where she is hoping for a small loan so that she can complete her objectives. On the other hand, she promises again to make her payments. In addition, she is thankful to be part of her association (communal bank), because all the members are responsible and united. Nélida, on receiving her support, will be able to set up two rooms with good materials in the manner of her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to prepare two rooms

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es: La señora Ana , es habitante del municipio de la concepcion , gracias al apoyo que durante varios ciclos le a brindado Afodenic atarvez de  los fondos Kiva , logro mejorar su condicioón de vida , ya que su cultivo puede sostenerse con su propia cosecha , ahora su sueño es poder construir su cocina que es uno de sus grandes sueños , pero no tiene el dinero suficiente para iniciar la contrucción ya que necesita comprar , bloques , cemento , arena, piedrin, entre otros materiales .
texts.en:
Ana lives in the municipality of Concepción. Thanks to the support that Afodenic has provided her for several loan cycles by means of Kiva funding, she has succeeded in improving her living conditions. This is because she can support herself by harvesting her own crop.

Now one of her great dreams is to be able to build her kitchen. But she doesn't have enough money to begun construction, as she needs to buy concrete blocks, cement, sand, gravel, and other materials.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Silvia Ines

texts.es:
Silvia de 58 años de edad, vive con su esposo y con su hijo, su casa en la que actualmente viven está ubicada en  el  Caserío Atahualpa Distrito de Tambogrande, distrito que pertenece a la provincia a de Piura la cual esta ubicada a unas 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Cliente vive en la parte rural  de este distrito el cual poco esta progresando por lo que por ahora solo cuenta con servicio básico de energía eléctrica.

Silvia vive en una zona netamente agrícola y ganadera por lo que ella no es ajena a esta actividad siendo su principal actividad económica, junto a su esposo crían y venden ganado ya un aproximado de 15 años dedicándose a esta actividad y mucho mas dedicándose a la agricultura, en la actualidad desean sembrar limón para lo que se asisten con tecnología media, la buena relación que existe entre ellos como familia es que ha generado que siempre se mantengan unidos en sus negocios y sus proyectos de vida.

Silvia en su deseo de cumplir sus metas y objetivos desea comprar fertilizantes para el cultivo de limón y compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de ganado y así poder comercializarlos ya sea en el mercado local o a sus clientes en los mercados aledaños. Inversión que con el tiempo tendrá sus frutos y mejorará su calidad de vida.

Silvia es una persona muy responsable, amable y trabajadora por lo que tiene una muy buena relación con todos los vecinos de caserío en el que vive.
texts.en:
Silvia is 58 years old and lives with her husband and her child. The house where she lives now is located in the Atahualpa neighborhood in the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura. It is located three hours from the city of Chiclayo. She lives in a rural part of the district which has progressed very little as right now, the area only has basic electricity service. 

Silvia lives in an area that is purely agricultural and focused on livestock. As a result, she too engages in this business as her principal financial activity. Together with her husband she has been selling livestock for 15 years, making her living in this business as well as working in agriculture. They currently want to plant lime trees which they can attend to with moderate technology. The good relationship that exists among them as a family is what has kept them united always in their businesses and their life projects. 

In her dream of fulfilling her goals and objectives, Silvia wants to buy fertilizers for her lime planting as well as feed to fatten up her livestock and in tha tway be able to sell them either in the local market or to her customers in neighboring markets. 

Silivia is a responsible, friendly and hardworking person. As such she has a good relationship will of her neighbors in the area where she lives.

loans.use: to buy feed for her poultry.

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Mame Diarra est créé le 27 décembre 2010, il est composé de neuf femmes qui sont parentes et amies. Le commerce est leur principale activité.

Madame Nogaye est âgée de 52 ans, elle est mariée mère de six enfants; elle mène une activité de vente de poisson séché avec une bonne expérience de plus de 32 ans.Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en boubou blanc avec fleurettes orange et un châle saumon sur les épaules.

Elle achète son poisson dans les villes où elle peut en trouver et le revend au marché central de sa localité.


Son prêt lui servira à acheter une bonne quantité de poisson séché pour se faire ainsi plus de revenus.


Elle souhaite constituer une bonne épargne qui lui permettra de mieux soutenir son mari et ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Sop Mame Diarra solidarity group was created on December 27, 2010. It is made up of friends and relatives. There are nine women in total. Commerce is their main activity.

Nogaye is 52 years old, married, and mother of six children. She runs a business selling dried fish and has over 32 years of experience. In the photograph, she is on the right-hand side, standing, dressed in a white boubou with little orange flowers and a salmon-colored shawl over her shoulders.

She buys her fish in the cities where she can find it, and resells it at the central market in her town.

She will use her loan to buy a large quantity of dried fish so that she can increase her revenue.

She hopes to build up a large amount of savings, which will allow her to better support her husband and her children.

loans.use: to buy dried fish intended for resale

loans.name: Diappo Liguey Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de solidarité de Diappo Liguey a été crée le 21/12/2009. Il est composé de 08 femmes toutes issues du même quartier. Elles font comme activité principale le commerce. Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, la responsable du groupe est mariée et mère de 09 enfants. Elle est âgée de 49 et fait du commerce, elle vend divers produits alimentaires dans sa boutique. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter divers produits à savoir du riz, du sucre, du savon, des biscuits et bonbons et des produits de détergents. Les bénéfices générés lui permettront de soutenir ses enfants dans leurs études et leur assurer une bonne alimentation .
texts.en: The solidarity group Diappo Liguey was created on 21 December 2009. It comprises eight women who all come from the same area. Their main activity is business. Standing on the right in the photo with her hand raised, the group leader is married and has nine children. She is 49 years old and sells various food items at her store. With her loan, she intends to buy various products, namely rice, sugar, soap, biscuits, sweets, and detergents. The profits generated from her business will allow her to support her children in their education and ensure that they are well fed.

loans.use: To buy various food items: rice, oil, sugar, soap.

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Bokk Jom est créé le 28 décembre 2010, il est composé de quinze femmes issues du même village et dont les activités principales sont l'élevage et le petit commerce.


Madame Fatel la responsable du groupe est une femme mariée mère de quatre enfants; elle est âgée de 74 ans. Elle mène une activité de transformation et de petit commerce d'arachide. Elle fait aussi de l'élevage, elle a une bonne expérience.Elle est debout à droite habillée d'un boubou khartoum rayé orange vert.



Son prêt lui servira à acheter des moutons et de l'arachide pour renforcer ses activités.



Elle souhaite aussi renforcer son épargne, appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille en nourriture et gérer ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Bokk Jom was created on 28 December 2010 and comprises 15 women who come from the same town and whose main activities are animal-rearing and business.

Ms. Fatel, the group leader, is a married mother of four children; she is 74 years old. She runs a business preparing and selling peanuts. She also raises animals, and has gained lots of experience. She is standing on the right in the photo, dressed in a Khartoum-style boubou with orange and green stripes.

Her loan will serve to buy sheep and peanuts to strengthen her business.

She also hopes to increase her savings, support her husband in providing for the family's food needs, and manage her personal needs.

loans.use: To buy sheep to raise and re-sell.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocío, de 19 años vive en compañía de sus padres y 3 hermanos menores a quienes apoya, en una casa alquilada ubicada en la ciudad de Huancayo.  A su corta edad, ya está logrando muchas cosas. Estudia la carrera de contabilidad en un instituto reconocido, gracias a ello ahora se encuentra trabajando en una empresa reconocida, en el área de digitación administrativa. Esto lo realiza durante las mañanas ya que en las tardes, estudia. Ahora que se encuentra de vacaciones, se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de ovejas, las cuales cuida en Huari, donde tiene su casa propia. Ahí comercializa los ovinos a un precio mayor al que compró. Además de apoyar a su mamá en la siembra de papa, oca, Nashua y habas, comprando fertilizantes y sugiriendo para la compra. Su principal objetivo es terminar una carrera universitaria por eso trabaja sin descanso, pues los gastos de mensualidad son altos y tiene que costearlos. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Santa teresa” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Rocío de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varias cabezas de ganado ovino para su negocio.
texts.en:
Rocio, 19, lives with her parents and her 3 younger siblings, whom she supports, in a rented home located in the city of Huancayo.  In spite of her young age, she is accomplishing a lot.  She is studying for an accounting degree in a distinguished institute, and thanks to this she is now working in a well-known firm, doing word processing for the business.  She does this in the mornings, because in the afternoons she studies.  Now that it is the school vacation she is working in her business buying and selling sheep, which she cares for in Huari, where she has her own home.  There she sells the sheep for a better price than what she paid for them.  In addition, she supports her mother with her cultivations of potatoes, oca (a South American tuber), nashua and beans, by purchasing fertilizers and advising her on these purchases.  Her main goal is to finish her university degree, and so to do this she works tirelessly, as the monthly household expenses are high and she has to pay them.  She is a member of the communal bank "Santa Teresa," and this is the second loan that she has taken with MFP, where she awaits a small loan to help her achieve her goals.  Moreover, she promises once again to comply with the payment terms of the loan.  In addition, she appreciates being part of her communal bank, because all of the members are supportive and responsible people.  

Upon receiving your support, Rocio will invest the money requested in the purchase of a number of sheep for her business.

loans.use: to purchase some sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pigslets and construct a housing unit for pigs.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 32 years old, married and a father of one child who is three years old.  His spouse is Everlyne, a business lady.  Philip does farming in Kapsabet  and has been in operation for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of KES 8,000.

He is servicing a first loan of KES 25,000 from KADET LTD  which he wishes to use to purchase seeds and fertilizers for his farm.  The anticipated profit he will use to expand the farm and support his wife's business.

He hopes to till more land and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a single lady aged 27 years old and supporting three members of her family. Her child is six years old. She owns a retail shop in Awasi trading centre and has been in operation for a period of eight years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

She is servicing a second loan from KADET LTD after she successfully repaid the previous loan and she intends to use this amount to purchase more business stock, e.g., washing detergent, sweets, and wheat flour for sale.  


The anticipated  profit will be used to plough back into the business and improve her living standards.She hopes to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase washing detergent, sweets, and wheat flour, etc. for her shop.

loans.name: Ulfatoi

texts.ru: Улфатой замужем и любящая мать шестерых детей. В 2005 году она начала заниматься скотоводством, чтобы обеспечить свою семью. Имеет богатый опыт работы в животноводстве. Раньше она жила очень бедно и не могла развивать свой бизнес, а затем постепенно приобрела 2-х голов мелкого рогатого скота. Теперь она очень старается расширить свой бизнес и улучшить свое жилищные условия. С этой целью она запрашивает займ в размере 3000 Сомони для покупки мелкого рогатого скота. Улфатой очень надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Ulfatoi is married and the loving mother of six children.  In 2005 she took up animal husbandry to support her family.  She has a great deal of experience with livestock.   She used to be very poor and couldn't develop her business, but later she eventually acquired two head of small cattle.  Now she is trying very hard to expand her business and improve her living conditions.  With this goal, she is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy sheep and goats.  Ulfatoi is hoping very much for your support and kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Donoziyo

texts.en: Donoziyo, aged 45 years-old, is a married man with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda.  He has been trading in produce for seven years and the business has been very lucrative.  He started as a peasant farmer and saved some money which he used to start his produce business.  Donoziyo needs the loan to buy maize to resell.

loans.use: to buy maize to resell.

loans.name: Stadhy Hermine Thècle Claudia

texts.fr:
Cliente  âgé de  35 ans, mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants dont l’âge varie entre 16  ans et  4 mois. 
N’ayant pas de soutient pour poursuivre ses études universitaires, elle  se lance dans le commerce depuis 09 ans.
Ses ventes sont considérables ; elle encaisse en moyenne 20 000 à 35000 F par jour. A l’octroie de se prêt ; elle va renforcer le stock de sa marchandise en achetant 4 cartons de poissons fumés, 2 bidons d'huile, 3 sacs de foufou, cuvette de tomate fraiches, carton des boites de tomate, 2 filets d'oignon, 2 cartons de poisson salés, 10 quakers d’arachides.
Afin de gagner une grande clientèle, elle achète sa marchandise en grande quantité.
Avec les bénéfices de ses ventes, elle pense épargner et à la longue ouvrir un dépôt de boissons. Comme une bonne mère de famille, elle aide son époux en faisant face au besoin de toute sa famille.
texts.en:
This client is a 35-year-old married mother of four children whose ages vary from 4 months to 16 years.
Not having had the means to pursue a university education, she has run a business for nine years.
Her sales are considerable; she earns on average 20,000 to 35,000 F per day. Upon the granting of this loan, she is going to expand her stocks of merchandise by buying four boxes of smoked fish, two cans of oil, three bags of fufu, a pot of fresh tomatoes, a box of canned tomatoes, two mesh bags of onions, two cartons of salted fish, and 10 bags of peanuts.
In order to gain a large customer base, she sells her merchandise in large quantities.
With the profits from her sales, she is thinking of saving and, in the long term, opening a drinks store. As a good wife and mother, she helps her husband in meeting the needs of her whole family.
